visions.title: The Vision of The Lord Jesus And The Reward Of The Saints!
visions.headerText: The Vision of The Lord Jesus And The Reward Of The Saints!
visions.content:
On the 23/04/ 2023 which was a Sunday Morning, I was in the place of prayer from 12 am to around 5 am, as My custom is to make intercession for the Church, the saints and Pastors that the Lord will Show Himself Mighty in our services by Many infallible proofs, and while I was praying, I saw 3 Visions, which are for the comfort, strengthening and encouragement of the Saints.

This is the First vision I saw, In this vision, I saw thousands of Saints upon a Great and High Mountain, which in the Spirit is called Mount Zion. This mountain had seven layers and I saw in one of the layers, thousands upon thousands of Saints working on the mountain, some were praying, some were teaching, while others were supplying the needs of those who were praying and teaching, and I saw that there were beings that moved in the midst of the saints with Scrolls and ink horns and were writing down in full details everything that were done by the saints. I saw that for those who prayed, all the hours to the minutes, they prayed were recorded and for those who taught, all what they taught was recorded.

I saw these Angels acend to another layer still on Mount Zion and on that Layer I saw the Spirits of Just Men Made Perfect, they were in councils and their discussions pertaining the Purpose of the Most High God in all the Worlds.

An Angel went into another layer and this time, he entered into a place where there were books, millions of books and there he kept the records of what he had written down.

While I was watching the vision, I heard a trumpet sound and all the beings both in the layer of the saints who were still on earth and those who are the layer of spirit of just men made perfect, everyone lay flat in worship and adoration to the Great King and Lord of Spirits - Jesus the Christ and I saw the Lord Jesus descended to the Layer of the saints who were still on earth but in service to him, and when He came before anyone of them, a scroll will appear in his hands, and He will read the things which were written in the scroll of the person and pronounce blessings upon the person, he did this for everyone one by one, and only the person who was being blessed could understand the words of his blessings but to others it sounded like tongues.

At this point, the vision ended and when I got up, the time was 6:30 am and while I was meditating on the vision to seek understanding, the Holy Spirit said to me...

/The Lord Jesus takes account to the details of all what is done for the glory of His name and the advancement of His Kingdom, the services and sacrifices done for the sake of Christ are not in Vain for He Himself is the Great Reward and Rewarder of the labour of Love of the saints, thus Let he who teaches, Keep teaching, let he who prays keep praying, let he who gives keep giving, let he who serves, keep Serving for the time of Rewards is at hand, but in all you do in words and in works let it be done in the Name of the Lord Jesus and for His Glory /

Then also I had an understanding by the inspiration of the Holy Spirit;
Only through ministering to the Lord in worship and praise can we receive the reward of our labour of Love in ministering unto the saints.

And while I was writing this vision, the Holy Spirit brought this scripture to My Remembrance;

Isaiah 62:11 KJV
Behold, the Lord hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.

Dear Saints be not discouraged on because you have not yet see a reward for your service and sacrifice for the Kingdom of Christ, for Many Christians it has gotten to a point where you are doubting if truly You are serving the Most High God, it has come to the Point that your Life has become a mockery to people on account of your service but be encouraged Dear Servants of God, if what you are doing is by the revelation of the Spirit and agrees with the Scripture then you are Serving God. Be encouraged by this Oracle and keep on doing the work God has entrusted in your hands for this is good in the sight of the Lord and in due time, he shall Reward You!

I pray for You, May the Grace of God strengthen your feet to walk with Jesus and empower your hands to work for Jesus, and May the Father and God of Our Lord Jesus, who is the Faithful Covenant Keeping God, Remember your labour of Love and give you a blessing that will make you the praise of your family.

Great grace
The Priest of God

questions.title: Question: Good day Sir, I love football but sometimes I have this fear in me that football can take me away from the Lord Jesus because of the kind of Passion I have for it, please I want to ask sir, is Football godly or worldly?
questions.content:
Answer: This question raises an important point regarding the subtle strategies through which the devil appeals to the world and how the Babylonian system has enslaved humanity. Let me begin by addressing the scriptural perspective on sports.

According to 1 Timothy 4:8 (KJV), bodily exercise is beneficial to some extent, but godliness is profitable for all things, in this life and the hereafter. The Holy Spirit approves of bodily exercise as it contributes to physical health and can even be financially rewarding for those pursuing a career in sports.

Having established that God is not against sports, including football, it is important to recognize that football, like any other natural activity, can be subject to spiritual influences. The main issue with football today lies in the spirit that influences it. The character of an activity reveals the spirit behind it. If an activity does not promote or enhance righteousness, it is not under the influence of the Holy Spirit.

Jesus spoke about the ministry of the Holy Spirit in John 16:8, 14 (KJV) when He said that the Spirit would convict the world of sin, righteousness, and judgment. We can discern the presence of the Holy Spirit in an activity by assessing whether it promotes the righteousness of God. Furthermore, an activity that glorifies the Lord Jesus is under the influence of the Holy Spirit. Therefore, we must examine whether football activities truly glorify the Lord Jesus or instead exalt and idolize human beings, thus magnifying the flesh.

Football, which initially started as a neutral activity for exercise and pleasure, has been exploited by Satan, the god of this world, to deceive and corrupt many, leading them away from the Lord Jesus. Satan has established a worldly system that turns people's hearts away from loving the Lord and towards loving the world. Scripture emphasizes that the whole world lies under the power of the Evil One (1 John 5:19, KJV), and Satan blinds the minds of unbelievers so that they do not perceive the light of the glorious gospel of Christ (2 Corinthians 4:4, KJV).

It is crucial to remember the admonition in 1 John 2:15-16 (KJV) not to love the world or the things in it. Loving the world and its pursuits, characterized by the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, does not originate from the Father but from the world.

Now, let's consider what exists in the world and compare it to football:

1. The Lust of the Flesh: It is noticeable today that betting companies have increased, and even Christians are engaging in betting on football matches. Even if they lose money, they are tempted to continue betting. Their flesh desires the potential gains.

2. The Lust of the Eyes: This is evident, especially when a football match is taking place, particularly if it involves the national team. People become engrossed in watching the match, and some are willing to pay significant sums for tickets to enter stadiums. Football becomes a visual temptation, with people staying up all night to watch matches, traveling from one nation to another to witness games. Some individuals even check scores during church services.

3. The Pride of Life: This is the pinnacle of football today. Conversations about football often revolve around who is the greatest or the best. Footballers are being exalted and glorified, even by Christians. It is shameful for a Christian to acknowledge someone other than Jesus Christ as a /god./ While Scripture mentions believers being called /gods,/ it refers to those who are born of Almighty God, not in terms of personal achievements. We are not gods because of what we have done; we are gods because we are born of God through the ministry of Jesus Christ. When a player is called the /god of football,/ it implies that Jesus Christ is not the God of football. Football is saturated with the Pride of Life, to the extent that humans have become idols to other humans. However, God explicitly warned against having idols, as John the Apostle stated: /Little children, keep yourselves from idols/ (1 John 5:21, KJV).

Scripture instructs us to stay away from idols, and yet football is a system that creates idols. People claim that certain players are their idols, which is a manifestation of the Pride of Life. Additionally, there is a term called /GOAT,/ which stands for /Greatest Of All Time./ This is a great deception. Let's turn to scripture to understand what goats represent. In Scripture, goats represent rebels and the disobedient. In Matthew 25:32-33, it is written: /And before him shall be gathered all nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left./ Furthermore, all the goats were sent to the lake of fire, as stated in Matthew 25:41: /Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels./

Notice that goats are referred to as the cursed ones and as messengers of the devil. As Christians, we should not use terms as the world does. We must seek the mind of God, which is revealed in Scripture. If Scripture refers to /goats/ as rebels, we should not reinterpret it to mean /Greatest Of All Time./ This is a worldly deception. Moreover, to truly understand the symbolism of goats, we must recognize its occult origin. In occultism, the goat is a symbol of Satan, the great rebel and disobedient one. In many movies and music, you will see the goat head symbol, which represents the devil. So, this labeling of /goat/ is demonic. When you call someone the /god of football/ or the /goat of football,/ you are essentially saying that they are messengers of the devil in football. How many of these individuals whom you call goats or gods of football have openly glorified or recommended the Lord Jesus? Instead, we see them supporting demonic agendas. Today, youths no longer consider Elijah, Moses, Joseph, or Daniel as role models; instead, they choose individuals who are not born again and do not acknowledge Jesus as their models. People now fight, insult, and become enemies because they have differing opinions on who they believe is the best player.

Now, let's conclude by discussing the Pride of Life in football and the significance of the trophies awarded in competitions such as the World Cup, African Nations Cup, European Nations Cup, and Champions League. Have you ever considered the nature of the reward given to the winners? It is a trophy, often made of gold, and the winners are known to kiss it. But where does this practice of kissing gold objects come from?

In Hosea 13:1-2 (KJV), it is written: /When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died. And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves./

Do not be deceived, the trophy given to the winners is an idol. How do you know it's an idol? Because it is worshipped. Remember the golden image in the Book of Daniel? In Daniel 3:4-5 (KJV), it is commanded: /That at what time ye hear the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, dulcimer, and all kinds of music, ye fall down and worship the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king hath set up./

The golden image in Daniel was meant to be worshipped by all nations. When a nation wins the trophy, public holidays are declared, and the trophy is paraded from town to town, attracting millions of people who come to see, touch, and kiss it. Have you ever wondered why players always kiss their trophies? In the past, kissing an idol was a way of pledging allegiance to it.

Therefore, football promotes the Pride of Life. Think about it: when you hear that a player has been bought for 100 million euros, is all that money simply for kicking a ball? No, it goes much deeper than that. These men are messengers of the Babylonian system. Some of them have contracts that forbid them from openly praising the Lord Jesus. Moreover, some of the gestures and signs made by footballers when they score are actually demonic symbols. Innocent youths imitate these signs, unknowingly becoming initiated into demonic worship.

Now, with this understanding, the question arises: Can a Christian be a professional footballer? Yes, it is possible, but such a person must submit themselves to be properly discipled in the doctrine of Christ and the ways of God. Otherwise, they may be led astray by the money and glory that football offers, forgetting that their primary assignment is to be a light in the football system and turn footballers to the Lord Jesus. All Christians have one assignment, regardless of their profession or location, and that is to reveal the Lord Jesus and lead many to Him. The skills and talents given by God are meant to be instruments of His glory.

For those who love football, I advise you to be cautious. Anything you love can become a snare to your soul if it is not centered on the Lord Jesus. You can watch and discuss football, but make sure you don't give yourself completely to that passion, or it will take control of your time, strength, and money. Remember what Apostle Paul said in 1 Corinthians 6:12: /Everything is permissible for me, but not everything is beneficial. Everything is permissible for me, but I will not be mastered by anything./

As a Christian, make the Lord Jesus famous. Let your Facebook page and WhatsApp status be dedicated to making Jesus famous. If you do post about footballers, only share the ones who publicly praise the Lord Jesus. Do not boast about those who are ashamed of Him before men.

Brethren, these are the last days, and the great war between light and darkness has begun. Unless we are spiritually discerning and sensitive, we will be deceived. As Scripture warns, Satan, the prince of darkness, disguises himself as an angel of light. Some may argue that terms like /goat/ mean /Greatest Of All Time/ or that calling someone the /god of football/ is not meant literally but as an honorific. However, we are instructed to abstain from all forms of evil (1 Thessalonians 5:22).

We should be sensitive and not deceive ourselves by using names or supporting teams that carry demonic connotations. Terms like /Red Devils/ or teams with dragon symbols are associated with darkness and satanic imagery. Let us not call evil good and good evil, darkness light and light darkness, as warned in Isaiah 5:20.

In these last days, seek the truth by committing yourself to fellowship with the Lord through prayer in the Spirit and meditation on the Scriptures. Remember to prioritize making Jesus famous and sharing the message of salvation with others.

questions.title: Question: Good day, Prophet. My heart is heavy because of the many failures I have experienced in life. My seeking of God seems to be in vain because I'm yet to see the manifestation of God, although I have received many prophecies and even visions. Due to the delay in fulfillment, I am now discouraged to even continue with spiritual activities. Please, how can I handle this? Thank you, Sir.
questions.content:
Answer: This question is very important because the answer will address one of the most fundamental challenges that all men face. Let me begin by stating that Christianity is not a means to escape the troubles of this world, as the Lord Himself said:

John 16:33 (KJV)
/These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world./

Many Christians have a misconception on this subject, which is why they are easily deceived by Satan into thinking that their trials mean that God hates them. However, scripture reveals that even the one whom Jesus loved was sick (John 11:3-4). When the devil manipulates you to perceive your trials and temptations as proof of divine hatred, he will turn your heart away from God and fill your heart with ingratitude and your mouth with complaints. Complaints in the mouth are a symptom that the heart is full of discouragement, as it is written:

Numbers 21:4-5 (KJV)
/And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way. [5] And the people complained against God, and against Moses, 'Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loatheth this light bread./

Now it is clear that discouragement is the evil spirit Satan assigns to make men deny God through their words or their works. We must be conscious that every trial and temptation is a strategy by Satan to discourage the faith of men in God and even prompt doubt in the love of God. This is what happened to the Israelites. For instance:

Deuteronomy 1:27: /You complained in your tents and said, 'The LORD must hate us. That's why he has brought us here from Egypt—to hand us over to the Amorites to be slaughtered./

You can see that, due to their trials, they were deceived by Satan into thinking that God hated them. This is exactly how Satan operates—through his evil schemes and operations, he causes trials in your life and then fills your heart with thoughts as though God hates you. Always remember that the purpose of Satan in every trial, temptation, trouble, and tribulation is to give men a reason to deny God. You can hear it from his own mouth:

Job 1:9-11 (KJV)
/Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, 'Doth Job fear God for nought? [11] But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will deny you to thy face./

Now I want you to understand that discouragement is not just a feeling; it is a spirit. It is one of the high-ranking evil spirits and one of the most deceptive and wicked demons of Hell. Whenever you feel discouraged, be aware that you are in a great spiritual warfare, and the devil is contending for your soul.

You must treat discouragement as you treat the devil because it is his servant. Discouragement, together with fear, are the most effective demons that Satan employs in his battle against the saints because they are subtle and operate silently, manipulating your hearts into sorrow and bitterness through evil voices that lodge in your heart as ideas. When you sense discouragement, know that Satan has come for you. Resist and rebuke it in the name of the Lord.

You must understand that what threatens Satan when he looks at men is not what they have done, but what they will do. Satan is threatened by the purpose of God attached to men, and the greatest spirit that hinders men from fulfilling the purpose of God is discouragement. See what is written:

Isaiah 42:1,4 (KJV)
/Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles. [4] He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law./

You can see that the Lord, speaking of His servant, said he shall not be discouraged until he has fulfilled his purpose. This is exactly what God instructed Joshua when He called him to lead the people into the Promised Land:

Joshua 1:6-7,9 KJV
/Be strong and of good courage, for unto this people shalt thou divide for an inheritance the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give them. Only be thou strong and very courageous, that thou mayest observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded thee: turn not from it to the right hand or to the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest. Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest./

Notice that the Lord said thrice, /Be courageous!/ You see how the Lord was preparing Joshua to fulfill his purpose by warning him against giving in to discouragement. Joshua had a great task ahead of him, and the devil would try to hinder him from fulfilling it. The greatest strategy of Satan would be to use the challenges Joshua would go through to try to discourage him.

Now, what God told Joshua is what He tells us all today: /Be strong and be courageous!/ How can we be courageous? The answer is in the scriptures.
1 Samuel 30:6 KJV
/And David was greatly distressed; for the people spake of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David encouraged himself in the Lord his God./

When David's wife and daughters were kidnapped, David encouraged himself in the Lord. This was done by meditating on scriptures. Often, when we are discouraged, we begin to seek signs from God through dream or other means. But this is wrong and may lead to more deception. The only encouragement that God gives us is through His Word.

For example, when John the Baptist was locked up in prison and became discouraged, he sent his disciples to Jesus. Let's see what happened:

Matthew 11:1-6 KJV
/And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities. Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples and said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another? Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see: The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them. And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me./

After John's disciples left, Jesus said something significant:

Matthew 11:11 KJV
/Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he./

Jesus did not send a message to John saying, /You are the greatest and most powerful prophet./ Many Christians expect God to encourage them in that way, asking questions like, /Am I still Your child? Do You still love me, Lord? Show me a sign!/ They are expecting a voice to speak from heaven or an angel to appear with a thunderous voice saying, /You are My very own child./ But that may or may not happen. Instead, when God wants to encourage us, He leads us to scriptures.

The answer that the Lord sent to John was from the Book of Isaiah, where it is written;

Isaiah 35:4-6 KJV
Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you. [5] Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped. [6] Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

The Lord referred John to this scripture speaking of what will happen when the Messiah comes, for whom John himself was sent to prepare the way, John was familiar with the writings of Isaiah so much that when the Pharisees asked who he was he answered them by quoting From Isaiah saying ;

Isaiah 40:3 KJV
The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

You see thus the Lord Sent John to scriptures to encourage him so that his faith might stand on the Word and not on signs. The only way to handle discouragement is to go back and meditate on scriptures. Don't ask for a sign or ask God to prove anything to you, for that would be unbelief. If you search the scriptures, you will realize that discouragement is a demon that often comes after great men and women of faith. It came after Moses (Numbers 11:15), Elijah (1 Kings 19:4), and even Jesus (Matthew 26:38-39).

However, they did not give in to discouragement. When the demon of discouragement came against Jesus, He prayed even more and encouraged Himself with the Word of God, saying, /Let the will of God be done!/

God does not always give us miracles to encourage us because if He did, we might become more focused on miracles than the His word and be easily deceived. Instead, God gives us His Word as a source of encouragement. Nehemiah 8:10 says, /Then he said unto them, 'This day is holy unto our Lord: neither be ye sorry; for the joy of the Lord is your strength./

When you become discouraged, search for scriptures and not rely solely on your feelings. Resist the feeling of discouragement with scriptures, because most often the ideas that lead men into discouragement are lies from Satan, he uses our circumstances to project ideas that makes us doubt the Love of God, the willingness of God and even the Faithfulness of God! And as Jesus taught us through his own temptation, the most effective weapon against Satan is what is written!

If You are discouraged, and there is an idea in your Mind implying that God does want to forgive your sins, or God does not went to show you mercy remember it is written; Psalm 86:5
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

If an idea comes up in your mind implying that God is not hearing you, or he does not want to deliver you, remember it is written;
Psalm 34:17 KJV
The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles!

If an idea comes up in your mind implying that God is unwilling to heal you then remember it is written;
Acts 10:38 KJV
How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.

We can go on and on, the Scriptures are full of wonderful truths from God that have power to destroy the lies of the devil!
So search the scriptures, speak the scriptures, and You will overcome! Don't surrender to discouragement, encourage yourself in the Lord!

visions.title: The Vision of the Saints, The Beasts and the Blood dripping from the Right hand of the Lord Jesus!
visions.headerText: The Vision of the Saints, The Beasts and the Blood dripping from the Right hand of the Lord Jesus!
visions.content:
Vision: On the dawn of the 27th day of the third month in the year 2023, I was caught up in the Visions of God and I received an Oracle from the Spirit of God for the Comfort and Victory of the Saints.

I saw a vision where, a group of Brethren were on a journey to a glorious city, the way to the city was full of Light but on both sides of the way there was a great cloud of Darkness, this journey was plagued with all forms of adversities and hardships to try them and prove their Faith in the Lord their God, but no matter the afflictions they strengthened themselves in the knowledge that the Lord God is their Rewarder and they encouraged one another to despise the pain and shame of their journey so they may be found worthy to obtain the crown of glory from the hands of the Great King!

At a certain point of the journey, the Bread and Water we had in our bags got finished and we began to be in want and our strength was diminished on account of thirst and hunger and some of the brethren began complaining bitterly and while we were in argument, we saw a pathway that was a deviation from the Main Way, and this pathway into the darkness led to a small city and some suggested that we go there to see if we May find bread and water there in.

While some refused, some insisted and thus there was a break away, some went into the city and found some women selling cakes, which they freely gave some to the brethren, and the brethren who had received this cake came back and joined the other company and more of the brethren went into the city and also received the cakes from the hands of those women and when they asked for water, the Women Said they have no water but they have wine, of which they gave to the brethren and they received them!

But some of the brethren refused to eat of the cake nor drink the wine that was brought from that City on the pathway of darkness!

Now the brethren came back on the journey and continued the journey then on the way, the eyes of those who received the wine became heavy, and they began sleeping on their way, when they began sleeping, suddenly ravenous beasts and wolves came out of the forests and began to devour some of them, and then a Battle began, and the brethren fought with all their might but those who hath drank the wine could not prevail because their eyes were heavy with sleep and they slept in the midst of the battles and they were overcome, but the other brethren fought and prevailed and the beasts ran back into the darkness that was on the waysides !

They wept for the brethren lost and they continued the journey and then something strange happened;

The brethren who had eaten the bread began to walk off the way, they were walking into different directions, some left and ran into the darkness, others turned back, yet others still began cursing other brethren, they began saying and doing things they did not want to do but it was beyond their power to control themselves, and while the other brethren were wondering what had happened, the Lord opened the eyes of the faithful brethren, and they saw that the cakes that these brethren had eaten had become WORMS in them, these worms were black but had the fangs of a scorpions and they had gripped the people in their heart, and the women who gave those cakes, were the Mistresses of those Worms and when they spoke the worms will make the people obey and do all what those women said even though they did not want so!

At this point, the Faithful brethren began praying for the other brethren and the Lightning of God began striking those worms in them and they died. And when they died, they came out from their mouth as white substance that looked like gum!

Now when those women saw what happened, they transformed into those beasts and this time around some fierce Men also joined them and turned into beasts and they came and surrounded the brethren and this time around the battle was fierce than before, for those beasts came at the saints with their full force, they brought forth Beasts, Serpents and Birds; and the saints prayed!

Oh they prayed and called upon the name of the Lord their God, and He answered them, for Heaven released Lightning that struck the beasts, then more and more beasts came forth, and they attacked from all sides, and those women spoke curses on brethren and their words came forth as sharp arrows, but the brethren also kept praying and their words came forth as Swords flashing left and right with fire!

At this point the battle became more and more intense, the saints were growing weary and they cried and called on the Lord Jesus, then it happened; Oh an Indescribable glory, a bright light appeared and illuminated the whole place, and in the Light there was a Cloud, and in the Cloud, There Was the Lord Jesus, He was standing Upon a Rock in the Cloud, the Rock was transparent and full of Fire, and He was dressed with a white Garment, and a Red Sash around his shoulder to his waist, and when he came, he opened his right hand and in his hand there was a wound hole in the middle of his hand, and out of it a drop of blood fell, when it touched the earth, there was earthquake, thunderings and lightnings, and immediately this happened: all the beast, serpents and birds fled, they fled with all their might yet the fire from the holy presence of the Lord devoured them!

And he strengthened the saints for out of the cloud came forth rain, that fell on the saints and they were revived, renewed and refreshed, And I saw how the brethren mounted up with wings as eagles and they walked and were not weary nor faint but soared high !

Then the Lord disappeared, but the cloud remained upon the saints, and as the saints began to rejoice, there appeared host of angels praising with them and a voice said, /There shall be Victory and Rest On All Sides through the Blood of the Savior for they believe /!

And then the Spirit spoke to Me and said:
/Publish this Word, there shall be Victory and Rest on All sides through the Blood of the Lamb unto those that Believe /!

I Kevin, the Priest of God, therefore publish this Vision that the saints may know that which is happening in the Realm of the Spirit!

All what I have written, I write before the Lord My God, for I Myself was part of the brethren in that vision, so I am a witness to this and I testify that the Blood of the Lord Jesus is Mighty on the behalf of the saints and I urge all the saints to set aside the Fourth Month of the Year ( April) which is the Season of Passover in the Calendar of Zion to Place a Demand on the blood of Jesus in prayers and fasting that they May obtain victory and rest on all sides !

Great Grace
The Priest of the Most High God!

visions.title: The Vision of Transfiguration
visions.content:
Vision: I was carried into the visions of God, and I saw a Man of God ( Cameroonian) ministering on an exalted altar. Behind him sitted on exalted thrones were the spirits of just men made perfect, these were men and women who had walked with the Lord, finished their courses and had slept in the Lord, I recognized many of them amongst which were; Apostle Zach Tanee Fomum of CMFI and Pa Njemo David of the Full Gospel Church Cameroon. And these Elders in the courts of Zion were watching the young man preach and were giving their approval of the message of the saving grace of our Lord Jesus that he was proclaiming.

My attention was drawn to a mystery; when the man of God who was ministering on the altar began looking above him to the heavens, a light from heaven illuminated his face and it began to shine like he was being transfigured and the light from his face began to shine upon the people who were listening and their faces too began shining.

Then a strange thing happen, as the young man continued ministering, at one point he began looking down to where the people he was ministering to were, immediately he began looking at them, his face became darkened and suddenly, a dark veil covered the people's faces. When he realized that, he lifted his head and looked above again, then he was transfigured again by the light from heaven and the hall was illuminated again. While he continued ministering, some people in the crowd began praising him and as he turned again and began looking down at the people, his face became dark again, and then he quickly lifted his head to look up again and his face was transfigured again, and the hall was illuminated.

Then while he was still ministering, some people in the crowd began to criticize him, and then as he turned to look down at them again his face became dark, and the dark veil covered the hall again. At this point the Man of God realized what was happening and he just purposed in his heart to keep his head lifted looking to the heavens while preaching, and no matter what the people he was ministering to say or do, he constrained himself not to give to them his attention, whether they praised him or criticized him, he kept his face looking above and as long as he kept looking above, his face was transfigured and shone like that of the Holy angels of YAHWEH Elohim.

Also I realized that when the man of God lifted his head to look above, the elders who sat on the thrones in the courts of Zion nodded their heads in approval, but when he looked down to the people they shook their heads in disapproval.

At this point, I was taken out of the vision, and as I pondered and meditated on this great mystery revealed, and the Holy Spirit brought this scripture to my remembrance:
They looked up to him and were lightened and their faces were not ashamed [Psalm 34:5]

May the God of all Grace who dwells in the midst of the Cherubim shine forth and enlighten the faces of His servants in Cameroon.

The Priest of God.

Prophet Kevin OnLine
