So God said /write the scriptures on your door posts and on your gates, so that whenever you are going out or coming into your house you see those scriptures and lay them up in your heart through confession/ but it did not end there, the Lord further instructed them to make bracelets where they have written scriptures upon and so when they go to their work, as they are working, they will be seeing the scriptures on their hands and thus remember the Word of the Lord and lay it up in their hearts through Confessions.

Now, a sticker is specifically for this purpose, on a sticker a portion of scripture is written and put at the door post and gates of the houses of they who believe in the Lord, and whenever the saints are coming in or going out, as they read that scripture and confess it, they lay it up in their heart through meditation and they experience the benefits of the Lord.

Same a wristband is a bracelet with a scriptures, that is upon the hands of the believer, so whenever he looks at his hands, he reads the scriptures and confesses it and through meditation lays it up in his heart.

Now even on a wrist band and sticker for example, it is written /I am The Redeemed of the Lord/ from Isaiah 62:12, when you are leaving or entering your house, you read the sticker and you confess I am the redeemed of the Lord, same thing while you are walking or working and you see the wristband on your hand and you confess I am the redeemed of the Lord. Now all these confession builds you in your Most Holy Faith and by that speaking, you are establishing that reality, remember the Lord Jesus said, YOU SHALL HAVE WHAT YOU SAY! [Mark 11:23].

I remember a testimony we had in church, we had made wristbands and wrote on them /I am the Redeemed of the Lord,/ and one of the disciples of Christ who worship with us was in a bus traveling and suddenly the driver began screaming while they were descending a hill that brakes had failed, and while everyone was panicking, the Christian too was panicking and while panicking he lifted his hands and saw the wristband he read it, i am the redeemed of the Lord, then suddenly he began confessing and declaring /I am the Redeemed of the Lord, untimely death is not my portion,/ then the car tumbled and fell in a ditch, some people died on the spot, while others were wounded but he came out unhurt.

Now it must be understood that it is not the wristband that saved him, it is the declaration of the Word that brought about his salvation for scripture says, /if you believe with your heart and confess with your mouth you will be saved./ God does not choose to save some people in accidents and allow others to die, no, God has given us his word and we are to use the word to make our way prosperous and have good success.

So the true intention of God in introducing wristband and stickers was to keep his people focused on his word to them so they can see the word and speak it forth at all times.

Wristbands and stickers are not charms that just work on their own, yes ofcourse there is a possibility that after these materials have been prayed upon, the anointing of God can be imparted on them so much that they can become instruments for signs, wonders and miracles to occur. This can be better understood in this account of scripture;

Acts 19:11-12 KJV
/And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul: [12] So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them./

Paul the Apostle was anointed of the Lord, and thus sometimes when some materials came in contact with him, the anointing was imparted to them and wherever those materials were carried the same miracles that would have happened if Paul was there, happened through those materials. This is a very common thing among the anointed, remember our Lord Jesus;

Mark 6:56 KJV
/And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole./

So do not consider it a strange phenomenon if signs, wonders and miracles happen through stickers and wristbands, because if the anointed of the Lord has prayed upon them, then Lord God can Graciously permit a measure of the anointing to be imparted on this instruments, and they can still work miracles even many many years after, remember this story ;

2 Kings 13:21 KJV
/And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they spied a band of men ; and they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha: and when the man was let down, and touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet./

You see here that Elisha died and many years later, a dead man's body touched his bones and the dead man came back to life. Definitely, it is not the bones of Elisha that raised the dead man, it was the anointing that was still resident there. Now just as the anointing can abide in bones of a dead Prophet and still work miracles, so can the anointing be imparted in stickers and wristbands and they work miracles also but nevertheless, the true purpose of this materials is to keep people meditating on the word of God.

If the Lord gives you a vision, prophecy, revelation or if you love a particular scripture, photocopy it and put it all over your house and room, write on your properties that you use the most so that you will see it all the time and when you see it confess it.

Now while it is true that many have merchandised this spiritual concept, it does not negate nor alter its efficacy. The Bible being the word of God is one of the greatest businesses, many companies [some even pagans] engage themselves in producing the Bible, because they want to sell it and make gains not because they want to spread the word of God, but the fact that you bought the Bible does not hinder you from reading it and growing in your knowledge of God.

Some churches sell stickers and wrists bands to make money, others sell them because they paid for its production and have to atleast recover the cost of production, whatever be the case, judgement belongs to God, we must not deny the saints the advantage and benefits of this materials because some covetous people are enriching themselves through them. Let us teach the saints and pray that they are guided by the Holy Spirit and take advantage of every system made available by God for their profiting.

questions.title: Question: Good day Prophet, I want to enquire about the issue of people falling under the anointing during prayers, manifesting strange behaviors and sometimes claim a demon is speaking through them. Honestly, I'm not really comfortable with this and sometimes I think it is just drama but I am open to what you have to say on this given that I've watched it happen in your ministrations.
questions.headerText: Question on Manifestation of Demonic Spirits during Prayer/Deliverance Sessions.
questions.content:
Answer : Shalom Dear Saint, your question is a good one and to do justice to it, we must put aside our feelings and cultures and base our understanding on scripture, for only the scripture is profitable for doctrine.

Now the act of people falling under the anointing during prayers is a common thing among the pentecostal and charismatic systems but it is a strange phenomenon to many main stream churches, like Catholic, Presbyterian and Baptist and thus the reaction of people to it is most often conditioned by the spiritual system they have subscribed themselves to.
In addressing this matter, we will base ourselves on the opinion of God as revealed in scripture and not on revelations and Angelic Encounters.

Now to address any occurrence in the Church, we must always seek reference from the ministry of our Lord Jesus, for he is the Author and Finisher of our Faith, thus whatever he did in his ministry is precedence set and pattern established for his servants to follow. We find out that in scriptures, people falling under the anointing of God was quite common, let's see some examples;

John 18:3-6 KJV
/Judas then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
[4] Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?
[5] They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I am he. And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.
[6] As soon then as he had said unto them, I am he, they went backward, and fell to the ground./

Now we see in this account, that the people who came to arrest Jesus, went backward and fell as soon as He said He was Jesus. Now what could have made this men to fall? Definitely not epilepsy. Were they pretending? Certainly not. Were they paid to fall? obviously Impossible! These men came on a mission to arrest Jesus but when he spoke, they were hit by a spiritual force. Now I will like to clearly state that this is The Anointing of the Holy Spirit, and if you are born of God through receiving the Holy Spirit then this same anointing is in you, intact scripture testifies thus;

1 John 2:27 KJV
/But the anointing which ye have received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as it hath taught you, ye shall abide in him./

The Lord Jesus in this account was demonstrating the power available for every Son of God to preserve themselves from all evil. If you are born of God, you have this same anointing in you, scripture says /as He is, so are we./ When evil men come against you in one way, there is an anointing in you that cause them to go back and seven ways. The Anointing of the Holy Spirit is the Spiritual force that takes men into the possibilities of God. What did Jesus do for the anointing to move? He simply confessed who he is. Confession is saying what God has said, when they came to arrest Jesus he was quiet and they advanced, but when he said /I am He,/ I am Jesus they all fell.
Nothing activates the anointing of God to move like the confession of who we are in Christ, scripture says;

Hebrews 13:5-6 KJV
/Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee. [6] So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me./

You see, he said that we may bold say. And what happens when we say what God has said?

Acts 10:44 KJV
/While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word./

Notice that when we speak the word of God, we activate the moving of the Spirit. So whenever the minister of God is preaching or praying the Anointing of the Holy Spirit Falls on they that believe and sometimes it hits them so hard that they fall, either for importation or for their deliverance from a demonic spirit.

We see this happened in the ministry of our Lord Jesus thus;

Luke 9:42 KJV
/And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and convulsed him. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father./

Now notice this instant, as Jesus asked for the man whose child was possessed to be brought to him, immediately the child approached Jesus, scripture testifies that /The Devil threw him down/ now this is disturbing, a devil can obviously not be seen, but the writer through the Spirit perceived that it is the devil that threw him down. Now we see that sometimes when prayers are made in church, devil can start throwing people down, and can cause them to manifest strange behaviors, sometimes you see the person begin to act like an animal, this is because the spirit that has possessed him is associated to that animal.

We need to be spiritual, we clearly see that a devil can throw people down, and notice that this only happened when Jesus asked that the child be brought to him. There are people who come to church and sit down, praise God, worship Him and are normal, until the minister of God by the anointing begins to confront the evil spirit in them, and then the spirit will begin to express itself though the bodies they have possessed. One thing you must Know is that demons will never leave on their own accord, ignoring demons in the hope that they will go is spiritually unwise, demons will not go unless they are cast out by believers, that is why Jesus said this;

Mark 16:17 KJV
/And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;/

Notice that the the first sign of being a believer is the ability to cast out demons. Jesus did not say You should wait for the demon to go, or you should ask God to cast the demon out NO, he said, if You believe you will cast out the demons. How are demons casted out? Jesus teaches us how;

Matthew 8:16 KJV
/When the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with his word, and healed all that were sick:/

Notice he casted out demons with his word, so it is what every believer has been empowered to do. When you perceive demonic activities, Cast out the Demons by commanding them in the name of Jesus, don't manage demons, Damage them, don't tolerate demons, obliterate them, Don't complain, come plain and Cast them out in the name of the Lord Jesus and you will testify like the apostles did;

Luke 10:17 KJV
/And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name./

Now this is what happens when a minister begins to confront satanic activity by the anointing of God, most often there will be a reaction from the devils, and they will often throw the people down, especially when they are resisting, devils only have some rest when they possess men so definitely they won't want to leave the person without a fight, that is why you hear the demons speaking through the person they have possessed, to beg, argue or even curse, it is not strange, it happened to our Lord Jesus, see this;

Mark 5:8-13 KJV
/For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit. [9] And he asked him, What is thy name? And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many. [10] And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country. [11] Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding. [12] And all the devils besought him, saying, send us into the swine, that we may enter into them. [13] And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea./

Now we see clearly how the mad man said, /we are many/ meaning something else was speaking through him. This is why you sometimes hear demons arguing with the Pastor, this is because they are trying to resist the deliverance for fear of losing their home.
Now sometimes in prayer, some people fall and become immobile on the floor, as though they are dead, now this also happened to the Ministry of our Lord Jesus;
Mark 9
/When Jesus saw that a crowd had come running, He rebuked the unclean spirit. /You deaf and mute spirit,/ He said, /I command you to come out and never enter him again./
26 After crying out, the spirit made the boy fall several times and convulsing him violently, the spirit came out. The boy lay on the ground like a corpse, so that many said, /He is dead./
27 But Jesus took him by the hand and helped him to his feet, and he stood up. /
Now You see after the Spirit made the child to fall severally, when it left him the boy was on the floor motionless, now for any Minister of God with experience they will immediately understand that the Spirit is gone.

Finally I will like to emphasize that falling under the power is not the requirement of receiving healing and deliverance, we must be careful not to miss the miraculous because we are looking for the spectacular. See this account;

Mark 5:27-30 KJV
/When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment. [28] For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole. [29] And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague. [30] And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that Power had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?/

Now notice that power went out of Jesus, yet the woman did not fall, she did not fall, she did not shake but she was healed.
The Miraculous is not in the Spectacular, it is in the Supernatural. The devil has robbed many of their healing and deliverance by making them think that because they did not fall or shake or manifest, they have not received from God.

Let's see this final example in Luke 13:11-13 KJV
/And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up herself. [12] And when Jesus saw her, he called her to him, and said unto her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity. [13] And he laid his hands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God./

We see a woman was been held bound by a satanic spirit for 18 years and was bent physically yet when Jesus rebuked the demon, the woman did not manifest or fall but she was delivered. Once more you see that falling is not a necessary requirement for receiving healing or deliverance but it is one of the effects of encounter with the anointing.

But let me end with an observation from that account, we see a woman who was possessed for 18 years and went to the temple often but was not delivered, this is because the Pastors [The Pharisees] did not make prayers that confronted and challenged that devil. Sometimes the reason why people do not fall in a church is not because they are too mature, it is simply because the pastors there do not challenge and confront the demons oppressing or possessing men. So I give you this counsel, when you perceive that things are not going well in your life as scriptures promises, confront and challenge demonic beings and cast them out, whether you fall or you don't fall, one thing is sure if you have faith in the Lord Jesus, then the Demon will obey you in His Name.

questions.title: Question: Good Day sir, I hear a lot of Pastors praying saying, /The God of My Father/! I will love to have more insight on that from the scriptures, thanks
questions.headerText: Throw more light on /The God Of My Father/
questions.content:
Answer: Let's get to scriptures to understand where this pattern comes from: The GOD OF YOUR FATHER
Genesis 49:25-26 KJV
/ Even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee; and by the Almighty, who shall bless thee with blessings of heaven above, blessings of the deep that lieth under, blessings of the breasts, and of the womb:
[26] The blessings of thy father have prevailed above the blessings of my progenitors unto the utmost bounds of the everlasting hills: they shall be on the head of Joseph, and on the crown of the head of him that was separate from his brethren./

We understand from this scripture that /the God of Your Father/ is a dimension of God invoked by Covenant with certain men.

There is nothing wrong to pray and say /the God of My Father help me/ because You are simply aligning yourself under a Covenant God has with a man (the man who fathers you), even as much as you cannot bless Yourself and God has committed the authority to bless the children in the mouths of the Fathers, in the same light, you can pray to the God of Your Father the person who has Spiritual authority to bless You and watches over Your Soul...

In Philippians 4:19, Paul said My God shall supply All Your Needs...

He could have said Our God or Your God , but if He said /My God/ it is not because his God is different, He is simply invoking the dimension of God he operates in through the Gift of Grace upon him...

It's the dimension of Grace operating in You that we Call /YOUR GOD.../

Galatians 1:24 KJV
/And they glorified God in me./
Who is God in Me ?
Is he different from the God in Heaven?
No, the God in Him is the Grace at Work on him....

Galatians 2:9 KJV
/And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision./

When we pray and say in the name of the God of My father or Pastor, we are not praying in the Name of our father or Pastor neither are we praying through them, we are Simply invoking the dimension of the Anointing of God operating through them, because no matter how we pray, the manifestation of God we experience is a function of the measure of Grace operating upon us, that's why as the Body of Christ, we need one another, because we all have different Graces and these gift of Grace is what determines the dimension of God we can introduce to this Earth realm to intervene in the affairs of Men...

Before God manifests himself through you, he first reveals himself to You,

Exodus 6:3 KJV
/And I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by my name Jehovah was I not known to them. /

Now God is saying to Moses that although I'm the God of ABRAHAM, Isaac and Jacob they did not know the dimension of Me Called JEHOVAH...

Jehovah means the self-existing One

Matter of Fact, the first time God appeared to ABRAHAM, he appeared as Elohim, after when Abraham Met Melchizedek, Melchizedek introduced Abraham to the dimension of God call EL ELYON, (and this was where the revelation of Tithes was introduced as a Principle to Honor God as the Possessor of Heaven on Earth and also the mystery of COMMUNION was introduced as a means to partake of the Divinity of God).

Genesis 14:18-20 KJV
/ And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine : and he was the priest of the most high God.
[19] And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, ( EL ELYON) possessor of heaven and earth:
[20] And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all./

We see that Melchizedek was the Priest of EL ELYON a dimension of God that ABRAHAM did not know , and he taught ABRAHAM that dimension of God...

After that in Genesis Chapter 15, God revealed himself to ABRAHAM as ADONAI...

Now it's the revelation of God to you that becomes your Altar. An Altar is not merely a platform, it's a revelation of God that provokes a specific manifestation of God on the earth realm, (we saw people build altars and named theme by their revelation of God, for example

> Abraham
Genesis 22:14 KJV
/And Abraham called the name of that place ( Altar) Jehovah-jireh : as it is said to this day, In the mount of the Lord it shall be seen./ > Moses
Exodus 17:15 KJV
/And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovah-nissi :/> Gideon
Judges 6:24 KJV
/Then Gideon built an altar there unto the Lord, and called it Jehovah-shalom : unto this day it is yet in Ophrah of the Abi-ezrites./ > Samuel
1 Samuel 7:12 KJV
/ Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpeh and Shen, and called the name of it Eben-ezer, saying, Hitherto hath the Lord helped us. /

When the Lord Jesus Came he brought the final revelation of Jehovah
Which is ABBA FATHER...

John 20:17 KJV
/Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and to my God, and your God./

And this revelation is what introduced the dispensation of Sonship that we are all Part of, and this is the dimension of God that the Earth has been waiting even as it is written ..

Romans 8:19 KJV
/For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God./

The Lord Jesus set the stage for the final manifestation of God on the Earth realm by introducing Jehovah as Our Father ...

The revelation of God that only Jesus could bring is that of his fatherhood, The Lord Jesus did not bring the revelation of God as a healer or saviour or deliverer the Prophets of Old did that, he brought in the revelation of God as our Father...

If You Check well The Lord Jesus never called Jehovah as God he always called him Father, the Only time he called him God is on the cross when he said in

Matthew 27:46 KJV
/And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is to say, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? /
But after he ended up again by identifying Jehovah as his Father

Luke 23:46 KJV
/And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost./ Now Christianity is built on the revelation that Jesus is the Christ and that JEHOVAH IS OUR GOD AND FATHER

John 20:17 KJV
/Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and to my God, and your God. /

Now we see two things, here GOD AND FATHER....
And this is how we relate to Jehovah in this dispensation...

Sometimes Apostle Paul will Pray to the God and Father of your Lord Jesus, sometimes he will Pray to the Father in Heaven, sometimes He will say My God, but this don't change that The God is still JEHOVAH and he is Praying in the Name of Jesus, this is to Lay emphasis on the dimension of God he wants to experience...

God is Covenant Keeping God, and therefore he manifests himself to Men according to COVENANTS, the Covenant God had with Abraham was so relevant that Christ died so that we can enjoy the blessing of the Abraham

Galatians 3:13-14 KJV
/Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:
[14] That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith./

We see here that the blessing of Abraham is coming upon us through Christ and not through Abraham, so when we Pray to the God of our Pastor, the Grace of God imparted on him by Covenant begins to Operate upon us through Christ !

Nevertheless, the Grace of God that will operate in our lives did not just depend on the Covenant God has with our Pastor or father, it depends on our FAITH IN CHRIST....
So I encourage you to build yourself in your most Holy Faith by prayers and meditation on scripture so that you can grow in Your knowledge of God and Grace be multiplied to You ...

If You don't Live according to the standard of the word of God which is Holiness you cannot experience the Grace of God.

Saying the God of My Father is not a means to bribe God to do something for You when You are disobedient to him...

Remember this scripture always ..

Acts 10:34-35 KJV
/Then Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
[35] *But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him ./
God is not unfair, God is not biased, God does not show favoritism but by reason of what Some People have done for God and the way they have walked with him, God as chosen to show himself to them in dimension he has not showed to others.

For example
God called ABRAHAM my friend ( Isaiah 41:8)
He called David a Man after my Heart ( Acts 13:22)
He called Job a blameless Man ( Job 1:8)

How did these Men get to the kind of relationship with God ?
It was simply by their Sacrifice for him ....
That's why Apostle Peter instructs us all thus,
2 Peter 1:10 KJV
Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

Give diligence to Make your Calling and Election sure and You will experience God…

There is no room for lazy people in the kingdom of God...
People who don't commit themselves in their fellowship with God because they are thinking on the Grace of their Pastor, in case You don't know, the Grace of God upon your Pastor does not work For You if You are not working out your salvation.

Philippians 2:12 KJV
/Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling./

It's clearly written /work out your OWN salvation,/ No one can work out your salvation for you, it’s Your responsibility.

questions.title: Question: Good day sir, please I'm confused concerning the subject of tithing, because I've heard messages for and against that practice, please help with this understanding, thank You Sir.
questions.content:
Answer: First of all we need to understand that the kingdom of God operates by mysteries and these mysteries cannot be discovered they can only be revealed (Matthew 13:11)
These mysteries are sacred truths of the kingdom that can only be accessed by revelation, Tithing is a kingdom Mystery!

Let us see from Scripture where tithing was introduced;

Genesis 14:18-20 KJV
/And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was the priest of the most high God. [19] And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth: [20] And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all./

Now we see here that the High Priest of God Melchizedek who is symbolic of our Lord is the one who introduced the Mysteries of Tithing and communion
Now its important to note that the Mystery of communion ( bread and wine ) was introduced at the same time with the mystery of tithes , now if you reject the validity of tithing today you may also go ahead and reject the validity of communion !

From the encounter of Abraham and Melchizedek we can see the relevance and The Purpose of Tithing!
We must understand that tithe does not originate from the Law of Moses, no! It was emphasized in the Law of Moses; Tithing was already practiced by the Patriarchs hundreds of years before Moses came!

Now if Tithing was relevant before Moses then it is still relevant today! Tithing is not of the Law nor of the Prophets , it is of the Patriarchs, its of The Priest hood and not in the order of Levi for Levi himself paid tithes , its the priest hood in the order of Melchizedek of which we are called today , Scripture says;

Hebrews 7:1-10 KJV
/For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;
[2] To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;
[3] Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.
[4] Now consider how great this man was , unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.
[5] And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham: [6] But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.
[7] And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.
[8] And here men that die receive tithes; but there he receives them , of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
[9] And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.
[10] For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchizedek met him./ br>
Notice verse 8 specifies that the Lord receives tithes Today by the Priest hood in the order of Melchizedek and not of Levi, which means the commandment of receiving of tithes today is given to the Priest not in the order of Levi who are subject to the Law of Moses but to the Priest in the order of Melchizedek who are Subject to the principles of the kingdom of God

There is nowhere the Lord condemned the act of tithing instead he recommended it ;

Luke 11:42 KJV
/But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone./

Notice what the Lord said? These /ought/ ye to have done, in other words you should tithe but you must not think you are justified by your tithe , now you are justified by faith expressed in Love!
Now let's go back to the origin of tithes in the scripture;

Genesis 14:18-20 KJV
/And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was the priest of the most high God. [19] And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth: [20] And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all./

Now we also understand from the account of Abraham and Melchizedek that we don't give tithes to be blessed ! No! We give tithes because you have been blessed !

Tithing is acknowledging God as the source of your achievement, Abraham went to war and came our victorious recovering a lot of material wealth , he gave his tithes to acknowledge God as the author of that victory

Let us see the account of Jacob

Genesis 28:20-22 KJV
/And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on, [21] So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the Lord be my God: [22] And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God's house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth ( tithe) unto thee./

Here again we see someone practicing the Doctrine of Tithing before the Law of Moses came , question who taught Jacob ?
Notice here that Jacob promises to give God a tithe of everything God gives him , this means tithing is a recognition that God is the source of your Provision ! When u don't give tithes you are saying that you made the wealth by your strength, and the scripture says ;
Deuteronomy 8:18 KJV
But thou shalt remember the Lord thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.

How do you remember the Lord ?
By giving him your tithes ! Your tithe is a Thanksgiving to God for Provision, your tithe is an acknowledgement that your prosperity is enhanced by the blessing of God, hence WE DO NOT GIVE TITHES TO BE BLESSED, WE GIVE TITHES BECAUSE WE ARE BLESSED! If you we are not blessed then how do we even have what we want to give tithes from?

Ad scripture says in 1 Corinthians 4:7
/For who makes you superior? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as though you did not receive it?/

We must be careful of Spiritual Pride, that makes appropriate the things God has given to be ours, we hear people say / no one can tell me how to use my money/...that Word /my/ is a dangerous word ! True humility flows from the understanding that all we have is a gift of God ! The scripture testifies thus;

Ecclesiastes 5:19 KJV
/Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat thereof, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labour; this is the gift of God./

When you understand that all you have is a gift of God, you will be submissive to his instructions on how and when he want to use what He has given to you !

Now what is tithe? It’s a tenth of all provision that is 10%!
Let's also be clear , You cannot say you are giving your tithe 20% or 50 % , if you give 50% of your income your tithe is 10% and these rest 40% is free will offering !

Tithes also is an expression of your submission to the authority of God , gentile nations gave their tithe to their king ! That's what Samuel the Prophet explained to the Israelites when they demanded a king!

1 Samuel 8:15,17 KJV
/And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants. [17] He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants./

Now whom you give your tithes to, is whom you serve!
Refusal to give your tenth to the king is symbolic of rebellion!
You cannot say because the king is very rich you will not give you tithes to him, no its wrong! Like some of us say, I cannot give my tithes to a rich Pastor; I prefer to give it to the poor! Now giving to the Poor is very good, but what you give to them is not a tithe it's a free will offering!

Citizens in every country pay taxes to the government through the government representatives, and they don't Pay taxes to be blessed, no its their responsibility towards their government, the government is a billion richer than those who pay tax but yet they must pay because that is the expression of their submission to governmental authority, now the government is responsible for distributing the taxes throughout the whole economy for the social amenities like roads, hospitals, security etc .
The issue is we should not tell People not to tithe because Pastors are rich , we should instead teach pastors what to do with tithes !
This is because your tithe is an expression of your submission to the authority of Jesus as your king!

According to scriptures before the Law of Moses tithe was given in the House of God ( Genesis 28:12) or to the priest of God ( Genesis 14: 20) but in the law, God instructed Moses how the distribution of tithes should be done !

Deuteronomy 14:22-29 KJV
/Thou shalt truly tithe all the increase of thy seed, that the field bringeth forth year by year. [23] And thou shalt eat before the Lord thy God, in the place which he shall choose to place his name there, the tithe of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the firstlings of thy herds and of thy flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear the Lord thy God always.
[24] And if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it; or if the place be too far from thee, which the Lord thy God shall choose to set his name there, when the Lord thy God hath blessed thee:
[25] Then shalt thou turn it into money, and bind up the money in thine hand, and shalt go unto the place which the Lord thy God shall choose:
[26] And thou shalt bestow that money for whatsoever thy soul lusteth after, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatsoever thy soul desireth: and thou shalt eat there before the Lord thy God, and thou shalt rejoice, thou, and thine household,
[27] And the Levite that is within thy gates; thou shalt not forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee.
[28] At the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithe of thine increase the same year, and shalt lay it up within thy gates:
[29] And the Levite, (because he hath no part nor inheritance with thee,) and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, which are within thy gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hand which thou doest./

We see here that God was emphasizing on tithing and not Introducing tithing for it was practiced before Moses came , here God showing Moses how to command the Priest to distribute the tithes less they take advantage an enrich themselves at the detriment of the needy !
But it is important to note that God is the one who choose where we should give our tithes , it is arrogance to choose where to give your tithes ! In this particular scripture God ordained his House as the place where the tithe should be brought whether for celebration or for distribution it had to be brought to the house and the Priest is the one who has ordained to receive the tithes and ensure distribution!

Now Christianity is a relationship with God and if by Fellowship you were Instructed by the Holy Spirit to give your tithes to a certain orphanage and you do not obey and you bring and give it to your Priest you may be wrong! And also if you just decide on your own to start giving your tithes to an orphanage when God has not commanded you so then you may be wrong also! This may be spiritual arrogance, spiritual arrogance is choosing how to obey the instructions of God !

Unless by instruction of the Holy Spirit , you should bring your tithes to the house of God and give it to the Priest of God who should now ensure distribution of the tithe to the Welfare of the Pastors , needy , the widow and the Maintenance of the House of God ! And also the spreading of the kingdom of God! So I believe that rather than teaching Christians not to give their tithes we should teach Pastors what to do with tithes so they do not take advantage of the meekness of the sheep! There is so much to say on this issue but Its better you pray and ask God and The Holy Spirit will teach you through the scriptures and Instruct you on what to do!
Great Grace

questions.title: Question: Good day Sir, I love football but sometimes I have this fear in me that football can take me away from the Lord Jesus because of the kind of Passion I have for it, please I want to ask sir, is Football godly or worldly?
questions.content:
Answer: This question raises an important point regarding the subtle strategies through which the devil appeals to the world and how the Babylonian system has enslaved humanity. Let me begin by addressing the scriptural perspective on sports.

According to 1 Timothy 4:8 (KJV), bodily exercise is beneficial to some extent, but godliness is profitable for all things, in this life and the hereafter. The Holy Spirit approves of bodily exercise as it contributes to physical health and can even be financially rewarding for those pursuing a career in sports.

Having established that God is not against sports, including football, it is important to recognize that football, like any other natural activity, can be subject to spiritual influences. The main issue with football today lies in the spirit that influences it. The character of an activity reveals the spirit behind it. If an activity does not promote or enhance righteousness, it is not under the influence of the Holy Spirit.

Jesus spoke about the ministry of the Holy Spirit in John 16:8, 14 (KJV) when He said that the Spirit would convict the world of sin, righteousness, and judgment. We can discern the presence of the Holy Spirit in an activity by assessing whether it promotes the righteousness of God. Furthermore, an activity that glorifies the Lord Jesus is under the influence of the Holy Spirit. Therefore, we must examine whether football activities truly glorify the Lord Jesus or instead exalt and idolize human beings, thus magnifying the flesh.

Football, which initially started as a neutral activity for exercise and pleasure, has been exploited by Satan, the god of this world, to deceive and corrupt many, leading them away from the Lord Jesus. Satan has established a worldly system that turns people's hearts away from loving the Lord and towards loving the world. Scripture emphasizes that the whole world lies under the power of the Evil One (1 John 5:19, KJV), and Satan blinds the minds of unbelievers so that they do not perceive the light of the glorious gospel of Christ (2 Corinthians 4:4, KJV).

It is crucial to remember the admonition in 1 John 2:15-16 (KJV) not to love the world or the things in it. Loving the world and its pursuits, characterized by the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, does not originate from the Father but from the world.

Now, let's consider what exists in the world and compare it to football:

1. The Lust of the Flesh: It is noticeable today that betting companies have increased, and even Christians are engaging in betting on football matches. Even if they lose money, they are tempted to continue betting. Their flesh desires the potential gains.

2. The Lust of the Eyes: This is evident, especially when a football match is taking place, particularly if it involves the national team. People become engrossed in watching the match, and some are willing to pay significant sums for tickets to enter stadiums. Football becomes a visual temptation, with people staying up all night to watch matches, traveling from one nation to another to witness games. Some individuals even check scores during church services.

3. The Pride of Life: This is the pinnacle of football today. Conversations about football often revolve around who is the greatest or the best. Footballers are being exalted and glorified, even by Christians. It is shameful for a Christian to acknowledge someone other than Jesus Christ as a /god./ While Scripture mentions believers being called /gods,/ it refers to those who are born of Almighty God, not in terms of personal achievements. We are not gods because of what we have done; we are gods because we are born of God through the ministry of Jesus Christ. When a player is called the /god of football,/ it implies that Jesus Christ is not the God of football. Football is saturated with the Pride of Life, to the extent that humans have become idols to other humans. However, God explicitly warned against having idols, as John the Apostle stated: /Little children, keep yourselves from idols/ (1 John 5:21, KJV).

Scripture instructs us to stay away from idols, and yet football is a system that creates idols. People claim that certain players are their idols, which is a manifestation of the Pride of Life. Additionally, there is a term called /GOAT,/ which stands for /Greatest Of All Time./ This is a great deception. Let's turn to scripture to understand what goats represent. In Scripture, goats represent rebels and the disobedient. In Matthew 25:32-33, it is written: /And before him shall be gathered all nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left./ Furthermore, all the goats were sent to the lake of fire, as stated in Matthew 25:41: /Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels./

Notice that goats are referred to as the cursed ones and as messengers of the devil. As Christians, we should not use terms as the world does. We must seek the mind of God, which is revealed in Scripture. If Scripture refers to /goats/ as rebels, we should not reinterpret it to mean /Greatest Of All Time./ This is a worldly deception. Moreover, to truly understand the symbolism of goats, we must recognize its occult origin. In occultism, the goat is a symbol of Satan, the great rebel and disobedient one. In many movies and music, you will see the goat head symbol, which represents the devil. So, this labeling of /goat/ is demonic. When you call someone the /god of football/ or the /goat of football,/ you are essentially saying that they are messengers of the devil in football. How many of these individuals whom you call goats or gods of football have openly glorified or recommended the Lord Jesus? Instead, we see them supporting demonic agendas. Today, youths no longer consider Elijah, Moses, Joseph, or Daniel as role models; instead, they choose individuals who are not born again and do not acknowledge Jesus as their models. People now fight, insult, and become enemies because they have differing opinions on who they believe is the best player.

Now, let's conclude by discussing the Pride of Life in football and the significance of the trophies awarded in competitions such as the World Cup, African Nations Cup, European Nations Cup, and Champions League. Have you ever considered the nature of the reward given to the winners? It is a trophy, often made of gold, and the winners are known to kiss it. But where does this practice of kissing gold objects come from?

In Hosea 13:1-2 (KJV), it is written: /When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died. And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves./

Do not be deceived, the trophy given to the winners is an idol. How do you know it's an idol? Because it is worshipped. Remember the golden image in the Book of Daniel? In Daniel 3:4-5 (KJV), it is commanded: /That at what time ye hear the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, dulcimer, and all kinds of music, ye fall down and worship the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king hath set up./

The golden image in Daniel was meant to be worshipped by all nations. When a nation wins the trophy, public holidays are declared, and the trophy is paraded from town to town, attracting millions of people who come to see, touch, and kiss it. Have you ever wondered why players always kiss their trophies? In the past, kissing an idol was a way of pledging allegiance to it.

Therefore, football promotes the Pride of Life. Think about it: when you hear that a player has been bought for 100 million euros, is all that money simply for kicking a ball? No, it goes much deeper than that. These men are messengers of the Babylonian system. Some of them have contracts that forbid them from openly praising the Lord Jesus. Moreover, some of the gestures and signs made by footballers when they score are actually demonic symbols. Innocent youths imitate these signs, unknowingly becoming initiated into demonic worship.

Now, with this understanding, the question arises: Can a Christian be a professional footballer? Yes, it is possible, but such a person must submit themselves to be properly discipled in the doctrine of Christ and the ways of God. Otherwise, they may be led astray by the money and glory that football offers, forgetting that their primary assignment is to be a light in the football system and turn footballers to the Lord Jesus. All Christians have one assignment, regardless of their profession or location, and that is to reveal the Lord Jesus and lead many to Him. The skills and talents given by God are meant to be instruments of His glory.

For those who love football, I advise you to be cautious. Anything you love can become a snare to your soul if it is not centered on the Lord Jesus. You can watch and discuss football, but make sure you don't give yourself completely to that passion, or it will take control of your time, strength, and money. Remember what Apostle Paul said in 1 Corinthians 6:12: /Everything is permissible for me, but not everything is beneficial. Everything is permissible for me, but I will not be mastered by anything./

As a Christian, make the Lord Jesus famous. Let your Facebook page and WhatsApp status be dedicated to making Jesus famous. If you do post about footballers, only share the ones who publicly praise the Lord Jesus. Do not boast about those who are ashamed of Him before men.

Brethren, these are the last days, and the great war between light and darkness has begun. Unless we are spiritually discerning and sensitive, we will be deceived. As Scripture warns, Satan, the prince of darkness, disguises himself as an angel of light. Some may argue that terms like /goat/ mean /Greatest Of All Time/ or that calling someone the /god of football/ is not meant literally but as an honorific. However, we are instructed to abstain from all forms of evil (1 Thessalonians 5:22).

We should be sensitive and not deceive ourselves by using names or supporting teams that carry demonic connotations. Terms like /Red Devils/ or teams with dragon symbols are associated with darkness and satanic imagery. Let us not call evil good and good evil, darkness light and light darkness, as warned in Isaiah 5:20.

In these last days, seek the truth by committing yourself to fellowship with the Lord through prayer in the Spirit and meditation on the Scriptures. Remember to prioritize making Jesus famous and sharing the message of salvation with others.

questions.title: Question: Good Morning Sir, please whats Your Opinion concerning Miracle Money, is it real or fake?
questions.headerText: What's Your Opinion concerning Miracle Money, is it real or fake?
questions.content:
Answer : First of all, I want to emphasize that my opinion is of no spiritual weight if it does not agree with the opinion of God as revealed in the scripture, and therefore as a Prophet of the Lord, I have no opinion apart of that which is revealed through the scriptures and the Spirit. The opinion of God is what stands because he is the author of all things and He is Sovereign.

Now, the opinion of God is found nowhere else but in the scriptures. You don't need to ascend into heaven to know the opinion of God, all you have to do is to search the scriptures, for the Major relevance of the scriptures is that it captures the opinion of God concerning all creation in all dimensions.

So with this understanding it is clear we should examine and judge every manifestation in the light of the scriptures and not our understanding.

The ways of God are past finding to the Carnal Man, it is written in 1 Corinthians 2:14, /the Natural Man cannot receive the things of God for they are spiritually discerned. The scripture goes ahead to emphasize that unto the natural man spiritual things are foolishness. This means that when you try to describe or understand a supernatural occurrence by your intelligence, it will appear as foolishness, the things are of the Spirit are so deep, so deep that it cannot be understood by the intellectual faculties.

Now having explained this, let me talk about the issue of Miracle Money. It all depends on what we mean by Miracle Money;
Firstly a Miracle can be defined as an extraordinary or supernatural occurrence that confounds intellectual understanding and defies physical laws. So A Miracle is the occurrence provoked by the intervention of God through the Faith of Man, that's why Ishmael was not a Miracle but Isaac was a miracle this is because Abraham did not Believe God to have Ishmael but he believed God to have Isaac.

And secondly money is defined as a commodity accepted by general consent as a medium of economic exchange.

So this means Miracle Money is the supernatural supply of Money, and this supply is beyond intellectual understanding and physical laws. Miracle Money is money received through Faith in the Power of God.

The Reason why many people doubt if Miracle Money is real is because it does not make sense to their intellectual faculties. Now, the scriptures declare that /unto the Natural Man, spiritual things are foolishness,/ this is because he cannot explain them by natural laws and physical procedures. Once you can explain a miracle by any other law but Faith, then it was not a miracle. The Only Law or means by which we can understand the Supernatural and comprehend Miracles is through Faith, for it is written in Hebrews 11:3,
Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.

Now this is very clear now, there is no physical way to explain or understand how the world was framed apart from Faith, scientists who attempted to explain creation by physical laws, introduced a foolish theory called Big Bang Theory, where they claimed that there is no God Creator instead the earth and all life came into being by an explosion... What foolishness!!! Man denying the existence of God, not knowing that if the creation doubts the existence of its Creator, then the Creation is also doubting it’s own very existence.

This is what happens to people who try to explain Miracle Money by physical Laws, you hear questions like;
Where does the money come from?
What a spiritually foolish question!
Is the Hand of the Lord Short?
Do we no longer Believe that with God All things are Possible?
What is the meaning of ALL THINGS? All as in /ALL/.
Now, let's search the scriptures, we start with this...

1 Kings 19:5-8 KJV
And as he lay and slept FCC under a juniper tree, behold, then an angel touched him, and said unto him, Arise and eat.
[6] And he looked, and behold, there was a cake baken on the coals, and a cruse of water at his head. And he did eat and drink, and laid him down again.
[7] And the angel of the Lord came again the second time, and touched him, and said, Arise and eat; because the journey is too great for thee.
[8] And he arose, and did eat and drink, and went in the strength of that meat forty days and forty nights unto Horeb the mount of God.

Now the question is this where did the Angel take that cake from ? Can that be explained?
Take note it was not a dream, Elijah ate that Cake physically...
Let's see another account,

John 6:9-13 KJV
There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many? [10] And Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
[11] And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.
[12] When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.
[13] Therefore they gathered them together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.

Now these stories are Intellectually senseless, how can five loaves or bread be used to feed 5000 Men, how come in the basket they were only 5 loaves and yet 5000 people ate until after all have eaten, they were 12 basket full ?
Where did the bread come from ?

For those who Say, Miracle Money is fake because God does not Print Money, God is not a bank, my question is this, id God a baker ? How did he bake bread to feed 5000 Men? If God can bake bread to help you meet needs can't he print Money to help you meet your needs?

Let's see another account again;

John 21:5-10 KJV
Then Jesus saith unto them, Children, have ye any meat? They answered him, No.
[6] And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.
[7] Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher's coat unto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.
[8] And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.
[9] As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.
[10] Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.

We see two miracle systems of provisions here, Firstly provisions that is released by an obedience to a Divine instruction, this is the Major way God intends to supply the needs of his people but also we see something, before they could even arrive the shores, they met fire coals with fish being roasted and already baked bread. My God! Now my question is this, where did Jesus take the fish and bread from? Is it physical or spiritual bread? Remember, this is Jesus when he arose from the Dead meaning he is in the fullness of His immortality.
Then Jesus said something to them; Come and Dine! Now this is it, He wanted to show them He is able to prepare all things for them by his power, yes! God can prosper you through an instruction which when obeyed will bring money and that is also miracle money, because Miracle Money may not be instant, Miracle Money may involve you to labour, offer services or selling of goods as along what you doing to get the Money is buy divine instruction then your salary or profit is Miracle Money, for example see this;

Matthew 17:27 KJV;
Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.

Now, you see that for this miraculous provisions, the Lord gave an instruction that employs Peter's skill which is fishing to make money, the question is what is a coin doing in the mouth of the fish?
We may say maybe a sailor lost money in the sea and the fish swallowed the coin but now next question amongst all the millions of fishes in the sea, how come that is the fish that Peter caught?
Next question how did Jesus know that the first fish would have coin in its mouth?
Who put that coin in the mouth of the fish? Was it an angel? JESUS was so sure that he instructed Peter to use a hook and not a net because if he used a net he would catch many fishes and will not know which one was the first, so Jesus told Peter get a hook because the first fish you catch will make you wealthy. Now, this is Miracle Money. By a divine instruction God can cause you to prosper and make wealth in businesses and places where it was otherwise impossible to make wealth, God may show you a business by revelation and it may not make sense to your mind but if you obey the instructions, you will prosper. If Peter where to reason what Jesus said intellectually, he would argue, Sir how can a fish have a coin in its mouth or Sir how do you know the first fish will have a coin, but Peter knew with God all things are Possible and also unto he who believes nothing shall be impossible! This too is Miracle Money!

But now there is another system of Miracle money which involves nothing on the part of man but his faith, where God commands his angels to come and put money in your account, or in your pocket or cause money to multiply, yes it happened with bread so it can happen with money, this one is unexplained but this is a sign of the willingness and the ability of God to prosper his people.

To conclude, let me explain two other systems through which Miracle Money can be gotten !

From scriptures we understand that favor is another system through which Miracle Money can be received, see this;

Exodus 3:21-22 KJV
And I will give this people favour in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty:
[22] But every woman shall ask of her neighbour, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters; and ye shall spoil the Egyptians.
Now we see here that God made his people rich by granting them favor. Favor is what makes the hearts of men favorably disposed towards you, meaning when you are favored, people give to you, even your enemies. This means a Minister of God can pray for favor and God employs the system of favor to supply Miracle Money, and thus he touches the hearts of Men to send Money to the people who he has favored, and that’s when you see people having mobile money alerts in their phones sent by Men, those men would not have sent that Money if not of the intervention of God through the his gift of Favor.

Also there is another way which God uses to supply Miracle Money to his people and truth is this, it is the most common way that God uses but it is the most despised because it is not as spectacular as the other systems, let's see it in scriptures;

Genesis 26:12-13 KJV
Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the Lord blessed him.
[13] And the man Prospered, and continued to Prosper , and grew until he became very Prosperous.
Now this system is called the Blessing. The scriptures testify thus;

Proverbs 10:22 KJV
The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
Now Isaac sowed, but he reaped a hundred fold, this now is impossible to men. In this system of Miracle Money, God sends his blessings to amplify that fruits of your labour and increase your harvest abundantly. Meaning a business which should yield 10,000, yields 1,000,000, most often people do not recognize this miracle money because they think it's their labour, make no mistake, it's not your labour. If acrording to economic laws you invest 10,000 units you should be making profits of around 1000 units but now if you invest 10,000 units and you are making profits of 100,000 units then 1000 normal profits while 99,000 is Miracle Money.
The mistake we make often as Christians is that when we receive prayer for Miracle Money, we think only on the system where God puts the money or multiplies it in our pocket supernaturally or the system where God by the gift of favor makes someone send you money, so after prayers of Miracle Money, if we check our pockets and our phones and do not see any money or mobile money alerts we think that God has not answered us not knowing that there are two other ways, either God has filled your mind with the Spirit of wisdom and Revelation that will give you ideas of business through which you will prosper or he has send his blessings upon the work of your hands to amplify and increase your harvest abundantly.

All in all, we must never doubt the willingness and ability of God to supply the needs of His people, God is a good Father and as a good Father, he gives good gifts, he cares about his children and he desires to meet their needs by any means fitting to him. We should avoid putting God in a box that fits well into our intellectual ideology.

There was Famine in the Land caused by Elijah and he was hungry, God did not ask him to go and look for a Job, God commanded a raven to bring him food daily, now does that make sense? Where did the raven take the bread from?

With God, all things are Possible, God being a good and compassionate Father wants to supply the needs of his people, this Jesus proved after preaching for 3 days and people where hungry he did not say go and look for a Job and then work and buy food to eat, he showed the compassion of God by miraculously supplying them bread to eat.

/There is more to say on this subject but I end here, whatever you need to know more about this, the Holy Spirit himself will give you understanding but above all, trust and depend on God to meet your needs and prosper you for He is your Father.
Great Grace
The Priest of God

questions.title: Question: sir, what do you think about the subject of Honorarium?
questions.headerText: What do you think about the subject of Honorarium?
questions.content:
Answer: I have received a lot of questions on our counseling number in regards to the subject of Honorarium and by the grace and wisdom given to me by God, this is my take on the subject.

Firstly, we must understand that Honorarium is a system to communicate honor; scriptures recommends us to communicate our honor, it is written;

Luke 10:5-8 KJV
And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace be to this house.
[6] And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.
[7] And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.
[8] And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:

Notice you receive Ministers of God by giving to them and not just in words, true honor is communicated in substance as scriptures says:

Proverbs 3:9 KJV
Honour the Lord with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

If the Lord Himself should be honored by substance how much more is it right to honor His servants with your substance!

It's true it's not about money, it's true we receive freely and are called to give freely but it's also true that there is cost to give, so when someone comes to minister to you and give you Spiritual substance, it has costed him time, strength, resources!
More so Apostle Paul establishes this principle in this scripture;

1 Corinthians 9:11 KJV
If we have sown unto you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?

You see it is recommended of scriptures that you reciprocate the release of Spiritual substance by the release of physical substances!

When you invite a Minister of God, prepare the substance you will use to communicate you honor to him for the Grace of God bestowed upon him; this is a proof of your reverence and honor for the God in him!
We Must never trivialize results, when a Man is excelling in a certain Grace in Christ, it's true it's the gift of the spirit but without his sacrifice of alignment he will not excel in that gift, we Must never despise, undermine nor overlook the exploits that men do through Faith in God, if it was that easy we all will be doing same !
The greatest responsibility of a host is to communicate honor to his guest. And what you use and how you do is a true proof of the honor you have for your guest.
Many at times some people run behind a Minister for him to come and Minister for them, they call him and text him for months, and then he finally accepts to come and then when he comes and Minister for them, after ministrations, they don't bother to even call or text again even to appreciate him for coming.
As he leaves the program, he does not hear from you again, others will not even give any honorarium and they will tell the guest I will call you after or I will come and see you later, some will bring some honorarium that does not even cover the transportation cost of your guest, and will give and say, this is just for fuel, or for credit! That's very dishonorable.
Now it’s not about Money, freely we received, freely we are called to give. But when someone ministers for you, what you give him is not to pay him for the gift of God in his life, it's in recognition of his sacrifice for you, imagine a Minister travelled to come and minister, risking his life ( in case of accidents), he comes and ministers for you, sometimes your sound is not very good so he stresses his vocal chords and throat in ministration, more so what about the activities he had to forgo to come Minister for you, so your honorarium is a proof that you recognize his sacrifice for you!

When you invite someone you must avoid being selfish and self-centered, don't only think how the program will profit you, think about what he will lose because of the program!
Most times we invite a guest and overwork them, refusing them even the luxury of rest, we want them to minister morning and evening, we want them to minister in Church until they are drained, this is selfishness, its true you need the grace God has given to him, but truth is, no matter how he ministers in the absence of honor the grace will not find expression into your ministry!

When you invite a Minister, his welfare should be your priority! Prepare what you will give him to eat and drink, (even if your church is fasting for the program don't impose fasting on your guest).
Have good cooks to prepare food, fruits and fruit juice for him and make it available on time.
After his ministrations, he should not go and wait for food, don't call him and tell him my daughter is bringing the food, No, if you are married, your wife should personally oversee his feeding, before he finishes preaching the food should be waiting for him!
After every session of his ministrations, send a message to appreciate him for that session and also to ensure if he is comfortable and if there is anything you can do to make his stay more comfortable!

And when he is done ministering, communicate your honor for him immediately both in words and substance, and to avoid finding yourself in a situation where you will not be able to communicate your honor accordingly in substance, it is advisable to prepare what you will give before the program, don't depend on offerings of the program, it may fail you woefully, don't also invite your guest and put him under pressure to raise money for the program.
Conferences and crusades are to raise men not to raise money, prepare yourself spiritually, financially and physically before organizing a program and inviting a guest, Remember don't only think about what you will gain because of the conference think about what your guest minister will lose to meet up with your program!

Finally, above all, build relationships with men so you will avoid saying they are proud or too demanding, there are Men that God has lifted to dimensions of glory, even if he chooses to minister for you, don't take it for granted!
Refuse to become familiar with a grace you admired after they have ministered for you, the same way you sent them messages night and day to plead with them to come so should you send them messages night and day to thank them for coming.

While it is true that some have abused this principle and turned the work of God into a business transaction where they argue and impose certain amounts before they move, this should not discourage us of practicing it because it is good and right in the sight of the Lord to honor his servants with our substance.

questions.title: Question: Good day, Prophet. My heart is heavy because of the many failures I have experienced in life. My seeking of God seems to be in vain because I'm yet to see the manifestation of God, although I have received many prophecies and even visions. Due to the delay in fulfillment, I am now discouraged to even continue with spiritual activities. Please, how can I handle this? Thank you, Sir.
questions.content:
Answer: This question is very important because the answer will address one of the most fundamental challenges that all men face. Let me begin by stating that Christianity is not a means to escape the troubles of this world, as the Lord Himself said:

John 16:33 (KJV)
/These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world./

Many Christians have a misconception on this subject, which is why they are easily deceived by Satan into thinking that their trials mean that God hates them. However, scripture reveals that even the one whom Jesus loved was sick (John 11:3-4). When the devil manipulates you to perceive your trials and temptations as proof of divine hatred, he will turn your heart away from God and fill your heart with ingratitude and your mouth with complaints. Complaints in the mouth are a symptom that the heart is full of discouragement, as it is written:

Numbers 21:4-5 (KJV)
/And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way. [5] And the people complained against God, and against Moses, 'Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loatheth this light bread./

Now it is clear that discouragement is the evil spirit Satan assigns to make men deny God through their words or their works. We must be conscious that every trial and temptation is a strategy by Satan to discourage the faith of men in God and even prompt doubt in the love of God. This is what happened to the Israelites. For instance:

Deuteronomy 1:27: /You complained in your tents and said, 'The LORD must hate us. That's why he has brought us here from Egypt—to hand us over to the Amorites to be slaughtered./

You can see that, due to their trials, they were deceived by Satan into thinking that God hated them. This is exactly how Satan operates—through his evil schemes and operations, he causes trials in your life and then fills your heart with thoughts as though God hates you. Always remember that the purpose of Satan in every trial, temptation, trouble, and tribulation is to give men a reason to deny God. You can hear it from his own mouth:

Job 1:9-11 (KJV)
/Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, 'Doth Job fear God for nought? [11] But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will deny you to thy face./

Now I want you to understand that discouragement is not just a feeling; it is a spirit. It is one of the high-ranking evil spirits and one of the most deceptive and wicked demons of Hell. Whenever you feel discouraged, be aware that you are in a great spiritual warfare, and the devil is contending for your soul.

You must treat discouragement as you treat the devil because it is his servant. Discouragement, together with fear, are the most effective demons that Satan employs in his battle against the saints because they are subtle and operate silently, manipulating your hearts into sorrow and bitterness through evil voices that lodge in your heart as ideas. When you sense discouragement, know that Satan has come for you. Resist and rebuke it in the name of the Lord.

You must understand that what threatens Satan when he looks at men is not what they have done, but what they will do. Satan is threatened by the purpose of God attached to men, and the greatest spirit that hinders men from fulfilling the purpose of God is discouragement. See what is written:

Isaiah 42:1,4 (KJV)
/Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles. [4] He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law./

You can see that the Lord, speaking of His servant, said he shall not be discouraged until he has fulfilled his purpose. This is exactly what God instructed Joshua when He called him to lead the people into the Promised Land:

Joshua 1:6-7,9 KJV
/Be strong and of good courage, for unto this people shalt thou divide for an inheritance the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give them. Only be thou strong and very courageous, that thou mayest observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded thee: turn not from it to the right hand or to the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest. Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest./

Notice that the Lord said thrice, /Be courageous!/ You see how the Lord was preparing Joshua to fulfill his purpose by warning him against giving in to discouragement. Joshua had a great task ahead of him, and the devil would try to hinder him from fulfilling it. The greatest strategy of Satan would be to use the challenges Joshua would go through to try to discourage him.

Now, what God told Joshua is what He tells us all today: /Be strong and be courageous!/ How can we be courageous? The answer is in the scriptures.
1 Samuel 30:6 KJV
/And David was greatly distressed; for the people spake of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David encouraged himself in the Lord his God./

When David's wife and daughters were kidnapped, David encouraged himself in the Lord. This was done by meditating on scriptures. Often, when we are discouraged, we begin to seek signs from God through dream or other means. But this is wrong and may lead to more deception. The only encouragement that God gives us is through His Word.
