For example, when John the Baptist was locked up in prison and became discouraged, he sent his disciples to Jesus. Let's see what happened:

Matthew 11:1-6 KJV
/And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities. Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples and said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another? Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see: The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them. And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me./

After John's disciples left, Jesus said something significant:

Matthew 11:11 KJV
/Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he./

Jesus did not send a message to John saying, /You are the greatest and most powerful prophet./ Many Christians expect God to encourage them in that way, asking questions like, /Am I still Your child? Do You still love me, Lord? Show me a sign!/ They are expecting a voice to speak from heaven or an angel to appear with a thunderous voice saying, /You are My very own child./ But that may or may not happen. Instead, when God wants to encourage us, He leads us to scriptures.

The answer that the Lord sent to John was from the Book of Isaiah, where it is written;

Isaiah 35:4-6 KJV
Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you. [5] Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped. [6] Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

The Lord referred John to this scripture speaking of what will happen when the Messiah comes, for whom John himself was sent to prepare the way, John was familiar with the writings of Isaiah so much that when the Pharisees asked who he was he answered them by quoting From Isaiah saying ;

Isaiah 40:3 KJV
The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

You see thus the Lord Sent John to scriptures to encourage him so that his faith might stand on the Word and not on signs. The only way to handle discouragement is to go back and meditate on scriptures. Don't ask for a sign or ask God to prove anything to you, for that would be unbelief. If you search the scriptures, you will realize that discouragement is a demon that often comes after great men and women of faith. It came after Moses (Numbers 11:15), Elijah (1 Kings 19:4), and even Jesus (Matthew 26:38-39).

However, they did not give in to discouragement. When the demon of discouragement came against Jesus, He prayed even more and encouraged Himself with the Word of God, saying, /Let the will of God be done!/

God does not always give us miracles to encourage us because if He did, we might become more focused on miracles than the His word and be easily deceived. Instead, God gives us His Word as a source of encouragement. Nehemiah 8:10 says, /Then he said unto them, 'This day is holy unto our Lord: neither be ye sorry; for the joy of the Lord is your strength./

When you become discouraged, search for scriptures and not rely solely on your feelings. Resist the feeling of discouragement with scriptures, because most often the ideas that lead men into discouragement are lies from Satan, he uses our circumstances to project ideas that makes us doubt the Love of God, the willingness of God and even the Faithfulness of God! And as Jesus taught us through his own temptation, the most effective weapon against Satan is what is written!

If You are discouraged, and there is an idea in your Mind implying that God does want to forgive your sins, or God does not went to show you mercy remember it is written; Psalm 86:5
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

If an idea comes up in your mind implying that God is not hearing you, or he does not want to deliver you, remember it is written;
Psalm 34:17 KJV
The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles!

If an idea comes up in your mind implying that God is unwilling to heal you then remember it is written;
Acts 10:38 KJV
How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.

We can go on and on, the Scriptures are full of wonderful truths from God that have power to destroy the lies of the devil!
So search the scriptures, speak the scriptures, and You will overcome! Don't surrender to discouragement, encourage yourself in the Lord!

questions.title: Question: Man of God, I came across this scripture in the Book of Revelation where the Lord Jesus said these words: /I know your works, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were either cold or hot. Since you are lukewarm and neither hot nor cold, I am going to spit you out of my mouth./ [Revelation 3:15-16] Sir, I would like to know what it means to be lukewarm and why Jesus preferred them to be cold which I think Is bad rather than lukewarm?
questions.headerText: What does mean to be lukewarm?
questions.content:
Answer: This is a significant question as it addresses one of the greatest issues currently plaguing the Church. The portion of scripture you refer to comes from the account of the messages that Lord Jesus sent to the Seven Churches. As the head of the Church, Jesus is deeply concerned about the state of His body, the Church. In His letters to each church, He commends them for their good works, rebukes them for their wrong works, and provides correction to help them conform to the image of Christ.

In our walk with God and our service for Him, it is essential to cultivate the habit of setting ourselves apart for the Lord in retreat. During these times, the Holy Spirit can reveal the counsel of the Lord to align us with His will. In these retreats, we come before the Lord to allow Him to search our hearts, ministries, and examine ourselves through the light of the Scriptures, so that we may walk before Him in perfection. It is easy to stray even while walking with God or working for Him, so we must frequently seek His counsel.
Now, let's examine the entire portion of Scripture:

Revelation 3:14-22 (KJV):
14 /And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write; These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;
15 I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.
16 So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.
17 Because thou sayest, I am rich, and increased with goods, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked:
18 I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.
19 As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.
20 Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hears my voice, and opens the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.
21 To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne.
22 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches./

In this scripture, the Lord rebukes and corrects the Church of Laodicea. It is important to note that this rebuke applies to the present Church age, as we are in the era where what Jesus described has become a reality.

In verses 15-16, the Lord expresses His displeasure with the lukewarm spiritual state of the Church of Laodicea. It is important to interpret the various spiritual states mentioned in the light of Scripture. Some people mistakenly assume that being hot is a good spiritual state and being cold is a bad spiritual state. However, if being cold were truly a bad spiritual state, Jesus would not have stated that He preferred the church to be either hot or cold. The Lord's dissatisfaction lies with lukewarmness, not with being hot or cold.

Let's analyze the spiritual states mentioned:

1. Hot: According to Scripture, being hot refers to a spiritual state where one is burning with zeal for the Lord. It is a state of being consumed by the fire of the Lord. In this spiritual state, one can be used by God to purify and revive others.

It is written;
Ezekiel 24:10-11 KJV
Heap on wood, kindle the fire, consume the flesh, and spice it well, and let the bones be burned. [11] Then set it empty upon the coals thereof, that the brass of it may be hot, and may burn, and that the filthiness of it may be molten in it, that the scum of it may be consumed.

An example of someone in this state is Jesus Himself when He cleansed the temple (John 2:13-17). And the Jews' passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem, [14] And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting: [15] And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers' money, and overthrew the tables; [16] And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise. [17] And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath consumed me up.

Another example was John the Baptist, the Lord testified thus ;
John 5:33-35 KJV
Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth. [34] But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved. [35] He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.

Notice John was not just a shining light he was also a burning one, zealous for the Works of the Lord.

2. Cold: In this context, being cold does not imply a negative spiritual state. The Lord desires the church to be in a state where they can refresh others. Just as cold water is refreshing to a thirsty soul, being cold refers to a spiritual state where one can bring refreshing to others. Scripture illustrates this concept with examples of cold water bringing refreshment;

Let's see from Scripture
Proverbs 25:13 KJV
As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

We see here that cold here is used to illustrate how refreshing a faithful messenger is, let's see another scripture

Proverbs 25:25 KJV
As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
Here we see again, cold water refreshes ! So when the the Lord said he wished if they were cold, he meant if they could be in a state where they can refresh others!
Remember what the Lord said we should do to his servants;

Matthew 10:42 KJV
And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.

Notice the Lord said, we should give a cup of cold water not cup of water, now imagine how refreshing cold water is to man who is thirsty or has journeyed under the sun.
The Lord's wish for the church to be cold means He desires them to be in a state where they can provide refreshment to others.

3. Lukewarm: This is the spiritual state where believers neither revive nor refresh others. It is a state of spiritual laziness and complacency, where one becomes unprofitable for the Lord's work. Scripture warns against slothfulness and encourages believers to be diligent (Hebrews 6:12). The lukewarm state described by the Lord in Revelation 3:16-17 is characterized by a focus on worldly wealth and a rejection of spiritual riches. The church in Laodicea was deceived into thinking they were self-sufficient, while in reality, they were spiritually impoverished, blind, and naked.

Luke warmness is indeed enhanced by carnality. The church in Laodicea had reached a state where they were focused on their physical well-being, particularly their wealth. They had been deceived into thinking that material possessions were all they needed, unconsciously rejecting the grace of God. The Lord provided them with a spiritual diagnosis, revealing that in the spiritual realm, they were miserable, poor, blind, and naked. Sadly, this pattern is evident in our present age, where the value of individuals is often measured by their material wealth. Many people forsake the Lord to chase after worldly pursuits, compromising their adherence to righteous standards for the sake of material gain.

The issue the Lord had with the church was not actually their wealth, but rather the fact that they had acquired wealth by their own efforts, without acknowledging God's grace. Notice that they said, /I am rich, I have become wealthy,/ without any reference to the Lord. They had indeed gained wealth, but not through faith and reliance on God's grace. Today, there are numerous Christians who are excessively focused on money, to the extent that they engage in unscrupulous practices in the name of financial prosperity.

Furthermore, spiritual Luke warmness fosters self-sufficiency. The church in Laodicea declared, /I have need of nothing!/ This self-sufficiency and self-righteousness lead us to believe that we do not require the grace of the Lord. Unfortunately, this mindset separates us from the Lord. Consider what the Lord said to the church: /Look! I am standing at the door and knocking. If anyone listens to my voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and eat with him, and he will eat with me/ (Revelation 3:20). How did the Lord end up outside? It occurs when we become overly preoccupied with worldly matters, when we adopt a carnal mindset, and when we forfeit our fellowship with the Lord. In doing so, we push the Lord away from our lives.

When one is hot, they have the ability to revive others, just like hot tea can warm you up in cold weather. When one is cold, they can bring refreshment, similar to cold water quenching your thirst on a hot day. However, when one is lukewarm, they become ineffective and unfit for any purpose.

But there is a solution. The Lord provided guidance in Revelation 3:19 (KJV):
/As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent./
In our present age, it is important to recognize the danger of becoming lukewarm and compromising righteous standards for the sake of worldly gain. We should strive to be zealous for the Lord, burning with His fire, and ready to refresh and revive others through our spiritual walk and service.

If you realize that you have forsaken the ministry of the Word, prayer, worship, and service to God, it is important to repent before the Lord and seek His grace. He will graciously lift you up from where you have fallen and make you useful for His work, just as He said:
/Therefore, I advise you to buy from me gold refined in the fire, so you may be rich; and white clothes to wear, so that you may cover your shameful nakedness; and salve to put on your eyes, so that you may see/ (Revelation 3:20).

questions.title: Question: Shalom Man of God. Please the Bible says in the book of Genesis that after God drove Cain away, Cain married his wife has children. Sir, who was the wife of Cain?
questions.headerText: Who was the wife of Cain?
questions.content:
Answer: This is a very interesting question because it demands insight into the scriptures and this insight can only be through the operation of the Spirit of Prophecy, it is written;

1 Corinthians 13:2 KJV;
And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge;

Notice here that the purpose of the gift of prophecy is not to enable a Man to know the names or problems of people but to enable a Man to know the know and understand the Mysteries of God.
Now let's first see the passage in scriptures;

Genesis 4:1-2 KJV
And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the Lord.
[2] And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

So we see that Cain and Abel are the only children of Adam introduced in the story and Cain killed Abel and after this he was sent away and the scriptures says this;

Genesis 4:16-17 KJV
And Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
[17] And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

Now this is where the question comes from. Let us first establish some truths we can discern in this story.

The First answer for this question is that Cain married his sister, now in those days before the Law was given to Moses, it was normal to get married to your sister, and obviously if Adam and Eve are the parents of all humans, then it means in the beginning the first generation of humans got married in the same family till they expanded, we see that Abraham married his step sister, he himself said this to Abimilech,

Genesis 20:12 KJV
And yet indeed she (Sarah) is my sister; she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.

So it is possible that Cain married his sister, because those where the only women on earth, even Seth the brother of Cain (who was later born to Adam as a replacement for Abel) obviously married one of his sisters.
Now we understand from scriptures that Adam had many sons and daughters, it is written;

Genesis 5:4 KJV
sons and daughters:
So we see here that Adam had many sons and daughters, Remember God blessed him to be fruitful, multiply and fill the earth, so therefore Adam and Eve definitely brought forth many children but the scriptures highlights only Cain, Abel and Seth because there are those though whom the purpose of God is being introduced in the earth realm.

Now the next thing we need to establish when Cain killed Abel is their ages, this also can be known through the scriptures, it is written;

Genesis 5:3 KJV
And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:

Now we know that Adam brought forth Seth after Abel was killed for scripture said this;

Genesis 4:25 KJV
And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.

So if Adam hath Seth at 130 years then probably Cain and Abel were around 100 to 120 years of Age when that event happened.
So meaning they by this time would have already had sisters, and one of them probably became the wife of Cain.

Now it is possible that Cain was already married even before he killed Abel but this also is a bit uncertain because according to scriptures he only knew his wife ( sexual relationship) and had his first son after he was driven away by God, so if he was married why did he not have children yet ? Unless he got married after he was driven away, now it is possible that he left with sister but this also is controversial because Adam and Eve may not have given their daughter to follow a Man whom the Lord has cursed and driven out of his presence.;

So this opens us up to another probability concerning the identity of the wife of Cain.
Now, the second probability is that Cain got married to a Fallen Angel, this i will explain in the next post.
Great grace
The Priest of God

questions.title: Question:  Shalom Man of God, please the Bible says that after God drove Cain away, Cain married his wife and had children, sir who was the wife of Cain?
questions.headerText: Who was the wife of Cain (Part 2)?
questions.content:
Answer: Now in answering this Question the first probability i gave about the identity of the wife of Cain, is that she May have been his sister (this is explained in the previous post)

But now I will give another probability!
Now the second probability concerning the identity of the wife of Cain is that she May have been A Fallen Angel!
This means that Cain probably married a Fallen Angel,
Now this may sound strange but let's get back to scriptures and explore this probability;

Genesis 4:16-17 KJV
And Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden. [17] And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

We see here that when God drove Cain, he left from the presence of God and dwelled in the Land of Nod. Now this is strange, how come there was a place on earth that was away from the presence of the Lord? What kind of Land was that, that was separated from the presence of God?

Now we need to go back and ask ourselves who founded that Land? And why is it called the Land of Nod?
Now to understand this we must go to the Hebrew text of scriptures because the Word /Nod/ is a Hebrew word and from the Hebrew dictionary the Hebrew word /Nod/ means /WANDERERS/ (Strong's Definitions : H5113)
So meaning Cain went to the Land of WANDERERS, who are these WANDERERS? Why was there a land on earth called the Land of WANDERERS?

Now who is a WANDERER?
According to Cambridge Dictionary a wanderer is defined as thus, /A wanderer is a person who travels around rather than settling in one place/
Now let's go to scriptures and see who description fits;

Job 1:7 KJV
And the Lord said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.

Now we see from here that Satan is a WANDERER, He goes to and forth the earth, the Lord Jesus Himself revealed again the truth that all evil spirits are wanderers;

Matthew 12:43 KJV
When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.

Now the word translated as 'walketh' is the Greek word: Dierchomai which means to wander (Strong's Definition: G1330)

So we see here that when Cain left the presence of God, he went to the land inhabited by Satan and his Fallen Angels who were accursed to be wanderers on the earth.

Now to further explain this, we need to go back to the temptation of Adam and Eve;

Genesis 3:1 KJV
Now the serpent was more subtle than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

Now this serpent who came and spoke to eve, who is he? Scriptures answers this thus?

Revelation 20:2 KJV
And he laid hold on the dragon, that old serpent, which is the Devil, and Satan, and bound him a thousand years,

So we see here that the serpent is none other but satan; so Satan was on earth in those days and he had access to the Garden of Eden, thus is probable that Satan was on earth and lived in the Land of Nod (WANDERERS) and had access to the Garden of Eden because at that moment, there was no angelic being guarding the entrance to the garden.

Now there is something interesting to notice here, when Adam and Eve sinned and God drove them out of the garden, He put an angel to guard the garden, now see this:

Genesis 3:24 KJV
So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

Notice that Lord blocked the entrance at the east side of the garden, now see where the Land of Nod was situated;

Genesis 4:16 KJV
And Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

Notice it was the east side?
Now let's move to some other scriptures that infers there might have been other beings on earth; when God drove Cain after he killed Abel, see what he said;

Genesis 4:14 KJV;
Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.

Cain told God, that since he has been driven away from his family and from God, anyone that finds him will kill him, now this is strange, who are those on earth who will kill Cain? Given that at that Adam had two sons Cain and Abel and the rest were daughters who is Cain afraid of that will kill him? Also if Cain is the first to know what killing is then why was he afraid that someone else knows it too, unless before he killed Abel someone advised him, because God said this to Cain before he killed Abel;

Genesis 4:6-7 KJV
And the Lord said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
[7] If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

Now it is probable that Cain was corrupted because he had surely come in contact with the inhabitants of the Land of Nod, who told him to kill Abel because Cain on his own will never know what killing his brother is, and more the Lord Jesus said this concerning Satan.

John 8:44 KJV;
Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning.

Notice that Jesus calls Satan a Murderer, and says he was a Murderer from the beginning but when we check the beginning it is Cain that murdered, when the Jews wanted to kill Jesus, he said they want to do the lusts of Satan, by this Jesus was saying that Cain carried out the lusts of Satan.

More scriptures define again who is a murderer;
1 John 3:15 KJV;
Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.

So when probably Satan filled the heart of Cain with hatred for Abel and that's when Cain became a murderer and carried out the lusts of Satan.
So when Cain killed Abel, and God drove him out of His presence, Cain was now afraid that those who taught him how to kill, would kill him as well.
Now at the probability that Cain married a fallen angel, let us see the scriptures again;

Genesis 4:16-17 KJV
And Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
[17] And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

Notice that the wife of Cain is introduced into the story only after he went into the Land of Nod, so probably, he met her there.
Now we know from scriptures that there are instances where Angels got married to Humans, it is written;

Genesis 6:1-2,4 KJV
And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
[2] That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
[4] There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.

We see here how Angels got married to Humans and gave birth to children. So such marriages are possible. Now you may say that scripture said /sons of God/ and not angels, but the scriptures reveal that in those days Angels were called sons of God.

Job 38:4-7 KJV;
Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding
.[5] Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
[6] Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
[7] When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
Notice God tells Job that when He was laying the foundation of the earth, the sons of God where there shouting for Joy, this cannot be humans because humans came only after the earth was created.

Second proof that those sons of God are angels is this;

Job 1:6 KJV
Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan came also among them.

We see a meeting of beings called Sons of God and Job the most righteousness man on earth in those days was absent there so thus those sons were not men and more so Satan too came.
So we see that Angels through a hidden strategy can take upon themselves the form of men or women and get married to humans.
So it is probable that Cain came in contact with Fallen Angels and got married to one of them, and this can also be deduced from another event;

Genesis 4:16-17 KJV;
And Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
[17] And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
Now when God drove Cain, he was alone so how did he build a city? One Man cannot build a house talk less of building a city, but there is something deeper there, he built a city in scriptures the word city stands for economy or civilization and when cain built a city he named it Enoch, now the word Enoch is a Hebrew word that means INITIATED (Strong's Dictionary H2596)
Now Cain call his city the city of the INITIATED, but why INITIATED? INITIATED into what?
To prove that this men were initiated into economy of fallen Angels we see this from scriptures;
Genesis 4:21-22 KJV;
And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
[22] And Zillah, she also bare Tubal-cain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.

We see that the Grand sons of Enoch are the ones who brought instruments of music and war on earth but we know from this instant that music had only been used in heaven (Job 38:7) and instruments for war were only used in heaven (Revelation 12:7-8) now how did the children of Enoch the child of Cain know mysteries that were known only of angels except they were initiated into the knowledge of those mysteries by Fallen angels.

Now I'm not saying that this is the truth of the Matter, it’s just a probability, scriptures itself is silent on this matter, for it is not written in the Bible who was the wife of Cain, but through the Wisdom of God we May interpret the silence of scriptures without necessarily drawing reason from extrabiblical sources.

So I do not impose this probabilities as truth, I advice you to study this for yourself and then also share your findings with me.

Great grace
The Priest of God

counsels.title: Counsel for Marital Relationships (01)
counsels.content:
The greatest cause for marital frustration is BROKEN EXPECTATIONS

Be careful of what you expect from your partner, you May be putting them under pressure to give to you what they do not have.

Most often, people enter marriage with EXPECTATIONS but they make the mistake of not telling their partner what they expect from them, unfortunately the partner out of ignorance of what the other person expects maybe doing the contrary things.

If you have expectations then tell your partner of them, so that they will tell you if they are able to give it to you or not, and if it is something they are not able to do when you tell them they will learn how to do it.

NEVER EVER expect your partner to know what your expectations are by assumptions or presumptions. For how shall they know if you don't tell them?

Other times, our experiences in our former relationships shape our expectations in our present relationships, meaning you either expect your partner to behave like your /Ex/, you will be constantly comparing them in your heart and sometimes you will say it to them; this is bad because you are hindering them from offering what they have. You are frustrating them from expressing their Love for you and to you by their own uniqueness because you want them to be like your Ex.

On the other hand, some other people because of the wrong things their ex did to them, they start interpreting their present partner's actions by their past experiences. When something happens they will either be thinking or saying; / this is how it began with that other person/ and they become very JUDGMENTAL, and this in turn suffocates the Love of the present partner who is confused because of the condemnation they receive even for matters that they did not intentionally do wrong or may not even be wrong.

It's more important to Focus on what You are bringing into Your marriage than on what Your Partner is bringing, this will help You to focus on enjoying the strengths and uniqueness of Your partner, while also proofing your Love by bearing their weaknesses and not complaining about them nor being offended because you did not expect that from them, for Your responsibility is not to complain about their weaknesses but to help them overcome them!

How do You think we Can handle the issue BROKEN EXPECTATIONS...?

prophetic_revelations.content:
I Kevin, the Priest of God, while in prayers was carried into the visions of God.

The plans of the wicked against the sons of Men were revealed unto me for the Lord God is a GREAT LIGHT. He sees and hears what is said and done in the habitations of darkness.

The Lord carried my spirit into a strange gathering in the habitations of darkness and I saw a conclave of demons. The demons were in a meeting and were planning how to attack families, marriages and homes.
I heard how instructions were given to all of them by the chief demon who presided over the meeting, he said :
/Enter their homes, set discord amongst them, and turn them against one another, quench the light of the house and crush the Pillars of the house so that it may crumble and the family become subject to unbearable sufferings that will cause them to go astray./

At this point the vision ceased. When I asked the Lord the meaning of this, this what the Holy Spirit brought to my remembrance:

Job 1:18-19 KJV
/While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house: And, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee. /

/And the Lord said to me that the Pillar of the Family is the one who is bearing the burden for the growth of the Family./

And then the Holy Spirit brought this scripture to my remembrance:

/Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house./
Matthew 5:15 KJV
And the Lord said: /the Light of the house is the person in the Family who was showing the family the way to Christ through their words and their works /And the Spirit said to me :
/I have shown you what the enemy has planned against the sons of Men. Engage the blood of the Lamb in prayer so that their counsel will be frustrated and their hands will not perform their devices/
Please I counsel everyone to take this vision very seriously and engage the blood of the Lamb for the preservation of your family!

I pray for you: /By the blood of the Lamb, the Light and the Pillar of your Family are preserved from the eyes and from the hands of the wicked in the Name of Jesus.../
Prophet Kevin OnLine
